description: Facebook is adding free video calls to its Messenger communications app, showing how quickly it is raising its game in a battle with other global tech behemoths to dominate every form of mobile communications.

title: Trying to Save the Oceans, One Small Grant at a Time
description: In the vast areas of the planet covered by water, human activity threatens the survival of countless species.

title: The Plight of Migrants in Libya
description: In a lawless country, African migrants must deal with smugglers and jailers, in addition to physical dangers, to reach Europe.

title: Before Dangers at Sea, African Migrants Face Perils of a Lawless Libya
description: ZAWIYAH, Libya  The two 8-year-old Eritrean boys had ridden for days across the deserts of Ethiopia, Sudan and Libya packed in the back of a truck with two other children and a dozen adults. Then they spent another month trapped in a crowded farmhouse that the smugglers used as a pen to store their human cargo.

title: A New Anthology Will Pay Tribute to Peanuts and Charles Schulz
description: They may not show signs of age, but in October, Charlie Brown and the Peanuts gang will turn 65. To celebrate, KaBoom, the all-ages imprint of Boom Studios, is publishing Peanuts: A Tribute to Charles M. Schulz, a 112-page hardcover by a team of contributors, which will include new comic strips and short stories, pinups and recollections of the influence of Snoopy and of Schulz, who died in 2000.

title: The Plight of Migrants in Libya
description: In a lawless country, African migrants must deal with smugglers and jailers, in addition to physical dangers, to reach Europe.

title: Art, Revelers and Fabulous Shoes at the New Whitneys Opening Party
description: The museums highly anticipated Meatpacking District location opened with a massive fte on Friday.

title: Ted Cruzs Gay Marriage Opposition Is No Secret
description: Its hard not to feel sympathy for Ian Reisner and Mati Weiderpass, the gay businessmen who invited a dozen people to dine with Senator Ted Cruz, the presidential poser, at their New York home. Mr. Reisner and Mr. Weiderpass had evident good intentions. There is certainly a shortage in this country of sensible political communication.

title: Google and Facebook Help Nepal Earthquake Survivors and Contacts Connect
description: In decades past, after a large-scale natural disaster, the people affected and their friends and loved ones often struggled to reconnect. In New York City after the Sept. 11 attacks, for example, phone lines were disrupted and people resorted to pinning missing-persons posters around the city.

title: Fresh Fungi: Growing, and Cooking, a Union Square Farmers Market Staple
description: The fashion photographer and farmer Greg Kessler teams up with New York chefs to trace the trajectory of seasonal food, from its original source to a place on your table. This edition: chef Michael Reardon (Margaux at the Marlton Hotel).

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: How Colleges Invest
For Teenagers, Potassium May Matter More Than Salt
description: A diet high in potassium appears to protect teenagers from high blood pressure in adulthood, while a low-salt diet had no effect, according to new research.

title: CNNs Peter Hamby Is Moving to Snapchat
description: For many young political reporters, the apex of television journalism is landing a job as a correspondent for CNN. For Peter Hamby, it is landing an editorial spot working at a hot smartphone app.

title: Mad Men Q&A: Jared Harris on Directing This Weeks Episode and Playing Lane Pryce
description: It seems fitting that Jared Harris directed Time & Life, this weeks episode of Mad Men, since it dealt with the future of Sterling Cooper & Partners, the oft-renamed advertising firm where he once toiled as Lane Pryce.

title: Review: Oliver Sacks Looks at His Life in On the Move
description: In a blunt, eloquent and devastating Op-Ed essay in The New York Times in February, Dr. Oliver Sacks revealed that cancer in his liver had left him with only months to live. This knowledge, he wrote, had enabled him to see his own life as from a great altitude, as a sort of landscape, and with a deepening sense of the connection of all its parts. He was grateful to have loved and been loved, and grateful, too, for the special intercourse with the world that writers and readers are privileged to know.

title: Routine Operations Could Save Millions of Lives, if They Were Available
description: Millions of people worldwide die from appendicitis, obstructed labor, compound fractures and other treatable conditions for lack of routine surgeries, according to a report released Sunday. Because too few surgeons and anesthetists practice in most poor and middle-income countries, five billion of the worlds seven billion people cannot get lifesaving surgeries or cannot pay for them, the report said.

title: Letters to the Editor and Online Comments
description: Ebola

title: High-Fructose Heart Risks
description: Only two weeks of modest consumption of high-fructose corn syrup causes cholesterol and triglycerides levels to rise, and the more consumed, the greater the increases.

title: The Brain Tumor Is Benign, but Threats Remain
description: In the frightening world of brain tumors, benign is a good word to hear. But even a nonmalignant tumor can be dangerous  especially if, as in my case, it goes undetected, becoming a stealth invader.

title: An Intimacy That Outlasted Dementia
description: Henry Rayhons, a farmer and former Iowa state representative, was acquitted last week of charges that he had sexually abused his wife, who had Alzheimers disease. He had been accused of having sex with her in a nursing home on May 23, 2014, eight days after staff members told him at a care conference that they considered her cognitively unable to consent.

title: Funeral After a Death in Police Custody
description: A funeral was held in Baltimore for Freddie Gray, a 25-year-old black man whose death from spinal injuries sustained while in police custody led to protests.

title: New Drug Czar Offers Hope to Addicts
description: The mandatory sentencing laws that swept this country during the 1970s and 80s filled the prisons to bursting with low-level drug offenders, many of them addicts who would have been more cheaply and effectively dealt with through drug treatment. But those who advocated treatment stood little chance against the war-on-drugs rhetoric that dominated the Reagan years, when Congress created the White House Office of National Drug Policy.

title: How to Keep an Artful Pot of Desert Plants Alive Indoors
description: A lot of people walk by and ask, Is this a gallery? Can we come in?' says Carlos Morera, a co-owner of the Cactus Store, which opened late last winter in L.A.s blossoming Echo Park neighborhood. Its no wonder passers-by are a little confused: The tiny storefront has no sign out front, and sells only cacti (and a few other plants), the bulk of which are displayed in unglazed terra-cotta pots perched on cinder blocks.

title: Bedraggled Denim
description: Distressed jeans turn punk rocks battered bad attitude into a commodified style for those with the social capital to dress in shreds.

title: Staying Where Mandela Did
description: Nelson Mandelas  home  in the Shambala Private Game Reserve in South Africa is now available for travelers to rent by the night. A few hours drive north of Johannesburg in a 24,000-acre reserve full of wildlife including elephants and zebras, the residence, called the Nelson Mandela Center for Reconciliation, was built in 2001.

title: U.N. Says Israeli Military Actions Killed 44 Civilians in Schools in Gaza War
description: UNITED NATIONS  Israeli military actions killed 44 Palestinian civilians who had sought refuge in seven United Nations schools during last summers conflict in Gaza, the United Nations said Monday in releasing findings of an internal inquiry.

title: Review: Elektra Cabaret, a Show by Ann Liv Young
description: Moments after Ann Liv Youngs Elektra Cabaret began at Joes Pub at the Public Theater on Wednesday, she interrupted the show, smack in the middle of belting out Beyoncs power ballad 1+1. This monitor, she said darkly, is way, way, way too loud.

title: Thawing Ice and Chilly Diplomacy in the Arctic
description: So long as the Arctic was mostly frozen solid, the biennial meetings of the eight-nation Arctic Council attracted relatively little attention with their discussions on ways to cooperate on environmental protection, search-and-rescue operations and the like.

title: Josh Hamilton Welcomes Latest Chance for New Start, With Rangers
description: Josh Hamilton returned to the site of his best days Monday, rejoining the Texas Rangers in a trade and saying that he never should have signed with the Los Angeles Angels in the first place.

title: On Food Labels, Calorie Miscounts
description: The method most commonly used to assess the number of calories in foods is flawed, overestimating the energy provided to the body by proteins, nuts and foods high in fiber by as much as 25 percent, some nutrition experts say.

title: The New Logic of Calorie-Counting: Take the Quiz
description: Heres some good news about your diet: you may be consuming fewer calories than you think.

title: An American in Paris Outsells Other New Shows on Broadway
description: Buoyed by strong reviews and a fondness for the movie that inspired it, the new musical An American in Paris last week brought in more money than any of this seasons other new Broadway shows.

title: Adam Wainwright Injury Should Reignite Designated Hitter Debate
description: By the time Mets pitcher Jacob deGrom reached Yankee Stadium on Sunday afternoon, he had heard the news that Adam Wainwright, the St. Louis Cardinals ace, might be lost for the season. Wainwright injured his ankle and Achilles tendon in an at-bat on Saturday night in Milwaukee. He was placed on the disabled list on Sunday, and the team announced on Monday that he would miss the rest of the season.

title: A Hospital at Home
description: Dr. Cameron Hernandez goes to homes of patients with certain diagnoses who have been admitted to Mount Sinai, but will receive their care at home.

title: Admitted to Your Bedroom: Some Hospitals Try Treating Patients at Home
description: When Martin Fernandez came into Mount Sinai Hospitals emergency room one recent afternoon, with high fever and excruciating abdominal pain, he and his family were asked an unexpected question.

title: In Performance | Fleming and Sills
description: Rene Fleming and Douglas Sills in a scene from Living on Love, Joe DiPietros new Broadway comedy about an opera diva and her egomaniacal husband. The show closes on Sunday at the Longacre Theater.

title: Teeth Tell of Earlier Trek to Europe by Humans
description: If you could find a Neanderthal or two to ask, you might get an earful on the current migrant rush to Europe.

title: Apples Earnings Surge, as iPhone Sales Jump and China Business Rises
description: Apples growth engine has now shifted unmistakably to China.

title: A State Dinner Preview, Toro Tartare Included
description: The White House led a walk-through of a state dinner on Tuesday honoring Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan. The menu includes toro tartare and Caesar sashimi salad, upper right, and American Wagyu beef tenderloin.

title: United Nations Internal Report on Gaza
description: Israeli military actions killed 44 Palestinian civilians who had sought refuge in seven United Nations schools during last summers conflict in Gaza, the United Nations said Monday.

title: Pictures of the Day: Nepal and Elsewhere
description: Nepal and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Ponchos With Panache
description: A wanderers wardrobe for the urban adventurer.

title: April 27, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Nepal, Yemen, South Africa and Kosovo.

title: Noteworthy Looks From the Tribeca Film Festival
description: Fashionable stars like Dianna Agron and Rebecca Hall appeared at events throughout the festival.

title: DuPont Shares Rise After Proxy Adviser Backs Nelson Peltz
description: Shares of DuPont leapt on Monday after an influential shareholder advisory firm backed efforts by the activist investor Nelson Peltz to win seats on the industrial conglomerates board.

title: Walkabout: Launch of the Apple Watch; Trouble With a Dance Move
description: Speak Into My Wrist The Apple Watch was released on Friday and the device is a target for many travel apps. Some are betting the smart watch will be convenient for translation. (The Economist)

title: Noteworthy Looks From the Tribeca Film Festival
description: Fashionable stars like Dianna Agron and Rebecca Hall appeared at events throughout the festival. Here are the photos.

title: First Draft Focus: Not Your Everyday Sightseers
Art, Revelers and Fabulous Shoes at the New Whitneys Opening Party
description: It might not have been the first event held at the Whitney Museums expansive, impressive new Renzo Piano-designed home in the Meatpacking District, overlooking the Hudson River. But the Whitneys Friday-evening opening party, which doubled as a preview for its inaugural exhibition, America is Hard to See, was worth waiting for: dinner, drinks and hobnobbing well into the night, a performance by John Cale and plenty of people-watching (those in attendance included Dakota Fanning, Sarah Jessica Parker and nearly any contemporary American artist you could name). Photographer Helga Traxler was on hand to capture the fete for T.

title: Lynch Sworn In as Attorney General
description: Loretta E. Lynch was sworn in as attorney general on Monday by Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. after a long delay to her confirmation.

title: Review: Rhythm in Motion, a Tap Dance Showcase, at Theater at the 14th Street Y
description: Like any sampler of new work, the American Tap Dance Foundations Rhythm in Motion showcase needs only to introduce a promising voice or an intriguing experiment to count as worthwhile. Many of the entries in this years second program, which had its debut at the Theater at the 14th Street Y on Saturday, passed the Id-like-to-see-more-of-that test. One of those segments even fulfilled the wish and kept returning.

title: Piecing Together a Deadly Encounter in Paris
description: PARIS  When news reached her hometown in northeastern France that Aurlie Chtelain, a 32-year-old fitness instructor and mother of a 5-year-old daughter, had been shot and killed in a Paris suburb, few who knew her could fathom why.

title: Review: Handels Orlando, the Second Part of a Trilogy
description: R. B. Schlathers production of Handels Orlando opened on Sunday for a two-evening run, but the performance really started almost three weeks ago.

title: Review: Bill Fays Who Is the Sender? Harks Back to Another Time
description: If youre interested in new pop that does not follow the current media discourse, that is gentle to the point of frailty, that prophesies but never quite disturbs, Bill Fay might be your man. New needs a qualification: Who Is The Sender is indeed a collection of new songs, but right out of the wrapper, they feel aged almost to the point of expiration.

title: Japan and U.S. Set New Rules for Military Cooperation
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama and Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan have reached an accord to tighten defense cooperation and are pressing toward an agreement to tear down trade barriers between their two countries and across the Pacific Rim, as both leaders move to counter rising economic and military threats from China.

title: Inside Bontonis Basement of Cobblers
description: The small, family-run company takes T on a tour of its artisanal operations in Italys Le Marche region.

title: Review: Ben Goldbergs Orphic Machine Influenced by Poetry
description: The high degree of difficulty on Orphic Machine, an enveloping new album by the clarinetist Ben Goldberg, has little to do with the formal intricacy or catalytic chemistry in his music.

title: Review: Zac Brown Bands Jekyll + Hyde
description: Ever since 2008, when the Zac Brown Band made its first overtures toward the country mainstream, it has stealthily tried to remake the genre from within. Extremely facile, with tendencies somewhere between bar band and jam band, it was able to pass for conventional country on early hits like Chicken Fried and Toes. But live concerts revealed something else entirely: a formidable, flexible country-rock outfit in search of bigger stages.

title: Review: Adam H. Weinerts Monument at the 92nd Street Y
description: How past dances live in the present is always on the mind of the choreographer and dancer Adam H. Weinert. His current project began after he reconstructed early solo works by the modern dance pioneer Ted Shawn. If, in dance, the body is a living archive  doesnt a dancer store and preserve movement over time?  Mr. Weinerts approach shows how a reconstruction can inspire a new work. With the premiere of Monument, performed on Friday at the 92nd Street Y, he does just that.

title: Repurposing an Old iPhone
description: Using Video

title: John Cages Music Receives a Dedicated Website
description: The New World Symphony, the orchestral academy founded by Michael Tilson Thomas to train graduates of top music programs, has long been known for innovative educational programs. Its newest venture, unveiled Monday evening in New York, is aimed more at music lovers than players: it is an ambitious website dedicated to the music of John Cage.

title: Rand Paul Calls Husseins Ouster a Mistake, and Qaddafis a Disaster
description: For some time, Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky, a Republican presidential contender, has been trying to persuade supporters of Israel and foreign-policy hawks in his party that he is not the isolationist many believe him to be. On Monday, he brought that message to a group of about 30 Orthodox Jewish leaders in Brooklyn.

title: Review: Quatuor Cambini-Paris Revisits Neglected French Composers
description: In a classical scene awash with accomplished young string quartets, the Quatuor Cambini-Paris stands out for two reasons. It revives the work of neglected French composers of the Classical and early Romantic eras. And its members  the violinists Julien Chauvin and Karine Crocquenoy, the violist Pierre-ric Nimylowycz and the cellist Atsushi Saka  perform on period instruments, using gut strings and antique bows.

title: Dance Review: Indian Culture in Every Muscle, From Eyelid to Fingertip
description: No dance form is an island. Last week brought me three genres of Western dance (ballroom, ballet, modern) and the weekend brought three examples of Indian dance. It reminded me that just as you can never fully know any one genre, each casts light on others. Watching Indian dance, this Westerner can only miss nuances obvious to many Indians, while making other connections.

title: Twitters Dick Costolo Delivers on Change, but the Right Mix Remains Elusive
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Twitters chief executive, Dick Costolo, has begun to follow through on his promise to reboot the company after the executive turmoil and product paralysis that dominated 2014.

title: Five of Messengers Discoveries About Mercury
description: Five things NASAs Messenger spacecraft, doomed to crash this week, has revealed about the closest planet to the sun.

title: A Feast of Architectural Styles for Expo Milano 2015
description: MILAN  James Biber can see Russia from his roof. Mr. Biber, the architect of the USA Pavilion at Expo Milano 2015, the worlds fair that is racing to meet its opening date on Friday, also has a good view of Kuwait next door and Iran across the street.

title: Inspiration From Hawaii in the Obamas White House China
description: WASHINGTON  Michelle Obama may be the first first lady whose nail polish matched her White House china service.

title: Jayne Meadows, Actress and Steve Allens Wife and Co-Star, Dies at 95
description: Jayne Meadows, a glamorous redheaded actress who starred on Broadway, in the movies and on television, but who was probably best known for her 46-year role as Steve Allens wife, business partner and frequent co-star, died on Sunday at her home in Encino, Calif. She was 95.

title: Painting Carousel
description: A look at Paolo Venturas set renderings for Carousel at Lyric Opera of Chicago.

title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch This Week
description: The best drama in the weeks big match may be taking place off the field. Soccer editor and shamelss Ajax supporter Andrew Das tells you what to watch.

title: A Complex Self-Portrait of Africa
description: A Nigerian photographer has devoted himself to documenting his nations social and political growth, offering an alternative narrative to the usual story of Africans as victims.

title: Invitation of Big Sean to Princeton Festival Brings Debate on Free Speech
description: Selecting performers for a college music festival can be a thankless job. Musical tastes vary, and students crave a big name.

title: Britains Drift From the Global Stage Becomes an Election Issue
description: LONDON  Its military reach has diminished. It has played little role in confronting Russia over Ukraine and strictly limited its response to crises in the Middle East and Africa. Its future in Europe is in question, and a recent snub of the Obama administration over China made clear that its alliance with the United States is no longer as central to either nation as it once was.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Review: Carousel, a Broadway Turn at Lyric Opera of Chicago
description: CHICAGO  In the past few years, Lyric Opera of Chicago has embraced the Broadway musical, producing revivals of classic shows at its splendidly grand house after the companys official subscription season has drawn to a close  as a dessert, you might say, after all the woe, betrayal and murder so richly represented in opera.

title: Paolo Ventura Designs a Carousel
description: The Italian artist Paolo Ventura was so unfamiliar with Rodgers and Hammerstein before he was asked to design a set for Carousel that he sometimes referred to them as Hammerstein and Rodgers.

title: Pope Francis Steps Up Campaign on Climate Change, to Conservatives Alarm
description: WASHINGTON  Since his first homily in 2013, Pope Francis has preached about the need to protect the earth and all of creation as part of a broad message on the environment. It has caused little controversy so far.

title: Protests Take Violent Turn in Baltimore
description: Police officers were injured during clashes with youths after the funeral for Freddie Gray.

title: Apple Pay Will Hit Best Buy Stores in 2015
description: For most consumers, paying for things with a wave of the smartphone is still a novelty. But many major retailers are clamoring to prepare for what could be a substantial change in the way we buy everyday items.

title: Now Booking
description: Rooms With Something Special

title: Loretta Lynchs Big Day
description: Ms. Lynch was sworn in Monday as the nations 83rd attorney general.

title: Loretta Lynchs Big Day
John Fairchild Memorial
description: Notables from the fashion and publishing worlds remember John Fairchild.

title: Fashion Pays Tribute to John Fairchild
description: You can tell a lot about someones personality merely by finding out what sort of food he puts on his plate. John Fairchild, the witty and irascible publisher of WWD, who died in February at 87, was a carnivore through and through.

title: Journalists Facing Biggest Threats in Recent Times, Advocacy Group Says
description: The ascendance of militant extremists and criminal gangs who abduct and kill reporters, combined with rising government repression in the cause of counterterrorism, has created the biggest threat to journalism in recent times, a press advocacy group said in an annual report on Monday.

title: N.Y.U.s Center for Ballet and the Arts Seeks Female Choreographers
description: A fellowship created to address the scarcity of female choreographers in ballet was announced on Monday night at the Center for Ballet and the Arts at New York University. The Virginia B. Toulmin Fellowship for Women Choreographers, to be offered to three candidates over a three-year period, will provide fellows a stipend of $35,000, along with office and studio space, access to housing in New York and close contact with other artists and scholars.

title: Why Chief Justice John Roberts Might Support Gay Marriage
description: ON Tuesday, when advocates press the United States Supreme Court for a nationwide right to marry for same-sex couples, they and their supporters will have reason to be optimistic. Since the court decided United States v. Windsor in 2013, a vast majority of state and lower federal courts  not to mention the wider public  have embraced the overwhelming moral, logical and evidentiary case for the freedom to marry.

title: Baltimore Youths Clash With Police
description: Hundreds of young people gathered outside a mall in northwestern Baltimore and confronted the police, throwing rocks and bottles at officers.

title: Maus Book About Holocaust Is Removed in Russia
description: MOSCOW  The governments plan was simple enough: Rid Moscow of swastikas or any other symbol of Nazism before Victory Day, the celebration of the Soviet Unions defeat of Germany and the most important political holiday in Russia.

title: Recovered From a Fall That Nearly Killed Him, a Trainer Gets Back to Winning
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Larry Jones, a trainer renowned for his ability to develop fillies, will saddle the prime contenders Lovely Maria and Im a Chatterbox in the 141st Kentucky Oaks on Friday at Churchill Downs, bidding for his third victory in the sports most prestigious race for 3-year-old fillies.

title: Tears Replace Cheers in Re-enactment of Farkhundas Killing in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  They killed Farkhunda again, but this time there were tears in the crowd rather than cheers.

title: Rangers Get Lift on Defense but Incur Loss on Offense
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The Rangers defense returned to full strength Monday, but their forward lines sustained a major blow.

title: United Nations Members Push to Open Search Process for Next Chief
description: UNITED NATIONS  Liechtenstein said the next secretary general of the United Nations must not be chosen in a back room.

title: Uncertainty Over Impact of a Default by Greece
description: When it comes to assessing the consequences of a messy Greek default on global markets, two views have vied for supremacy in the minds of investors.

title: Summonses for Minor Crimes Keep Falling, Report Says, but Many Still Lead to Arrest Warrants
description: In 2003, police officers in New York City issued 557,570 summonses for the lowest-level offenses, like drinking in public or riding a bike on the sidewalk. A decade later, in 2013, the annual total fell to 439,029, and it continued to drop last year.

title: Elon Musks Ex-Wife on What It Takes to Be a Mogul
description: For advice on how to be a mogul, take it from someone who has been married to one.

title: Agent Who Supervised Investigation of JPMorgan Cyberattack Takes a New Job
description: A top federal agent who was helping to oversee the criminal investigation into the hacking attack against JPMorgan Chase last summer is leaving for a job with a private investigation firm.

title: Closing of Carnegie Deli Amid Con Ed Investigation Disappoints Diners
description: On Tuesday morning, inspectors from Consolidated Edison are scheduled to show New York City investigators what they brought back from the Carnegie Deli near Central Park.

title: Wladyslaw Bartoszewski, 93, Dies; Polish Auschwitz Survivor Aided Jews
description: WARSAW  Wladyslaw Bartoszewski, an Auschwitz survivor who battled both the Nazis and the Communists, was given honorary Israeli citizenship for his work to save Jews during World War II and later surprised even himself by being instrumental in reconciling Poland and Germany, died here on Friday. He was 93.

title: A Photographer in Katmandu Assesses the Earthquakes Damage
description: Patrick Adams, 36, an American writer and photographer who specializes in public health reporting, was in Katmandu Saturday when a major earthquake hit the country, killing nearly 4,000 people. Since then, Mr. Adams has been traveling around the city to see the destruction, and talking to victims and health care workers at the citys teaching hospital.

title: A Pay-Per-View Knockout Unites Two Rival Networks
description: HBO and Showtime usually operate in separate orbits of the boxing universe: Linked to different promoters, they feature different fighters.

title: 2016 Candidates Are United in Call to Alter Justice System
description: WASHINGTON  The last time a Clinton and a Bush ran for president, the country was awash in crime and the two parties were competing to show who could be tougher on murderers, rapists and drug dealers. Sentences were lengthened and new prisons sprouted up across the country.

title: Marketing No. 660 Could Cost Yankees Even More
description: After Alex Rodriguez drew to within one home run of Willie Mayss total of 660 on Sunday night, there was no sudden change in the Yankees approach to the contentious matter. They still do not intend to pay Rodriguez a bonus that he believes he is owed for matching Mays.

title: M.T.A. Official Warns Board That Fare and Toll Increases May Be Needed
description: A top official at the Metropolitan Transportation Authority warned board members on Monday that they may need to raise fares and tolls by 15 percent if state lawmakers do not provide funding for the agencys five-year capital plan.

title: Off-Duty Officer in Fatal Crash on Staten Island Was Drunk, Officials Say
description: Tests show that the off-duty New Jersey police officer whose wrong-way crash on Staten Island in March killed a colleague and another passenger in his car had a blood-alcohol level three times the legal limit, officials said on Monday.

title: Back on Track
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Greetings! I hope you all had a good week, and thanks again to the very tall and extremely dapper Tom Gaffney for taking the reins while I was on vacation.

title: Cardinal Timothy Dolan Confers a Rare Papal Knighthood on Rabbi Arthur Schneier
description: Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan, the leader of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York, conferred a papal knighthood on Rabbi Arthur Schneier on Monday, citing the good works that hes done to promote religious freedom and international peace.

title: Obama Proposes That Medicare Be Given the Right to Negotiate the Cost of Drugs
description: WASHINGTON  Embedded in President Obamas budget request to Congress is a paradox. He proposes a major new initiative to develop drugs tailored to the genetic characteristics of individual patients, but he expresses deep concern about the costs of such specialty medicines for consumers and for the Medicare program.

title: Capitals Eliminate Islanders, Extending Two Decades of Playoff Futility
description: WASHINGTON  Islanders goalie Jaroslav Halak stood in front of his locker, the picture of disappointment. Hands on hips, he stared disconsolately at the ground, dripping sweat, his face showing the frustration he felt minutes after his teams season ended.

title: Six Are Shot, Two Fatally, Outside a Brooklyn Church After a Funeral
Mets Gee Pitches Deep Into Game, and Murphy Goes Deeper, Into Seats
description: MIAMI  In the visitors dugout, Dillon Gee watched nervously as the ninth inning started. Dealing with rumors and speculation about his status, Gee had pitched about as well as he ever had, four outs from a complete game. But the Mets still trailed the Marlins, 1-0, with Miamis closer, Steve Cishek, taking the mound.

title: Republicans in House and Senate Agree on a Budget
description: WASHINGTON  Republican negotiators on Monday reached a compromise on a joint budget between the House and the Senate, the first common congressional budget in a decade.

title: Italian American MuseumGives a Tenant More Time to Move
description: An elderly woman whose pending eviction from her apartment in Manhattans Little Italy by the Italian American Museum was denounced by housing advocates has until June 30 to leave under an agreement between the two parties.

title: Hoping for a Milestone From Alex Rodriguez, Yankees Fans Settle for a Win
description: Fans flocked to Yankee Stadium on Monday to see a milestone for Alex Rodriguez. They had to settle for just another Yankees victory instead.

title: Merger in Brooklyn Is an Alternative to Citys Small-School Model
description: A decade after New York City shut down a large, struggling middle school in Brooklyn and replaced it with two smaller ones, the Education Department is putting those schools back together and is likely to combine several others. The two schools, Middle School 354, the School of Integrated Learning and, M.S. 334, the Middle School for Academic and Social Excellence, which share a building, were created in 2005 when the administration of Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg broke up a large and violent middle school in Crown Heights.

title: Deron Williams Buries Self-Doubt, and Seven 3s, as Nets Pull Even
description: To grasp just how good Deron Williams was feeling Monday night, consider the uncharacteristic moment of unadulterated celebration he allowed himself with seven minutes left in regulation in the Nets game against the Atlanta Hawks.

title: Amid Violence, Factions and Messages Converge in a Weary and Unsettled Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE  The middle-aged woman buried deep in a crowd of protesters near the intersection of North Fulton and West North Avenues held up a yellow sign with black lettering. One side issued a demand: Stop the lethal force. The other provided what could be seen as an ominous warning: Pow pow you reap what you sow.

title: Traditional Mexican Food Enters the Hearts and Kitchens of Barcelona
description: In the past year, Barcelona has joined Chicago and Los Angeles as one of the most satisfying places in the world to eat Mexican food outside of Mexico. Unlike other parts of Spain, notably the Basque Country, Barcelona has no deep, direct historical connection with Mexico (aside from an expat refugee community that lived there during the Spanish Civil War, and some modest recent immigration), and the traditional Catalan palate is quieter than Mexicos. But three new restaurants in the capital  Hoja Santa, Nio Viejo and Oaxaca  reflect the citys growing culinary curiosity, and just how gastronomically cosmopolitan it has become during the last few years.

title: Inside a Precious Landmark, Abstract Paintings of Diamonds
description: The French conceptual artist Mathieu Mercier resists calling himself a painter. Im not inspired by having the brush in front of the canvas, he says, and most of his pieces dont compel him to even pick one up. His Drum and Bass series entailed placing red, yellow and blue objects on black shelves to resemble Piet Mondrians compositions; Mercier has also constructed sculptures from stacked boxes of Glad trash bags and Aim toothpaste. You can make masterpieces with what you have in your room, he claims. Everything is there  its how to make sense of it.

title: Inside Bontonis Basement of Cobblers
description: Italys Le Marche region is an incubator for artisan cobblers like Bontoni, a small family-run company in the rolling, grassy dales of Montegranaro. The company was founded in 2004 by Franco Gazzani and Lewis Cutillo, distant cousins that are part of a family that has been making made-to-measure mens shoes for nearly a century. In recent years, fashion Goliaths like Tods have located their shoe factories here, and many of the small, older family cobblers have all but disappeared. But that hasnt deterred Gazzani, who still handcrafts mens shoes with his father and seven employees at the shoe laboratorio in the basement of his own home. While this is a business, we also think that what were doing here is preserving a piece of local history and excellence that is slowly slipping away, Gazzani says.

title: Fashion Site Raises Funds to Speed Its Global Growth
description: Refinery29, a fashion and lifestyle media company, will announce on Tuesday that it has closed a $50 million round of financing from Scripps Networks Interactive and the advertising giant WPP. The investment values the company at about $300 million, according to a person with knowledge of the deal, and brings its total financing to $80 million.

title: Word of the Day | injurious
description: injurious  \in-jur-e-s\  adjective

title: Life Term for Captain in South Korea Ferry Disaster
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The captain of the South Korean ferry that capsized a year ago, killing more than 300 people, most of them teenagers, was sentenced on Tuesday to life in prison in an appeals court ruling that convicted him of murder.

title: Fear and Limbo in Katmandu
description: Since Saturdays earthquake, tens of thousands in Katmandu have slept outside, wary of aftershocks and the threat of collapsing buildings.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday
description: 8 P.M. (ABC) DANCING WITH THE STARS: 10TH ANNIVERSARY SPECIAL More than 45 sequin-adorned and spray-tanned dancers  among them members of the current Season 20 roster as well as a returning 15 celebrities and seven professionals  will waltz, mambo, tango and cha cha their way across the ballroom floor. Highlights include a bromance paso doble featuring National Football League players past (Donald Driver, Hines Ward, Kurt Warner, Emmitt Smith, Michael Irvin and Jerry Rice) and present (Jacoby Jones); a showdown between the Season 18 winners, Meryl Davis and Maksim Chmerkovskiy, and the reigning champions, Alfonso Ribeiro and Witney Carson; and a performance of Lady Marmalade by Patti LaBelle, Lil Kim and Amber Riley.

title: Kentuckys Same-Sex Marriage Fight
description: A portrait of two families with differing views of the same-sex marriage argument in Kentucky. The states gay marriage ban is one of four being considered by the Supreme Court on Tuesday.

title: Corrections: April 28, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: This is not what the family asked for, today of all days. For us to come out of the burial and walk into this is absolutely inexcusable.

title: After Nepal Earthquake, Funeral Rites
description: Survivors bury the dead after last Saturdays earthquake in Katmandu, Nepal.

title: A Complex Self-Portrait of Africa
description: Holding a retrospective exhibit after only 15 years as a professional photographer may seem unexpected. But such was the timing for Akintunde Akinleye, the only Nigerian photojournalist to have won a World Press Photo prize, in 2007. Since then, he has continued his work for Reuters, capturing life in the heart of Lagos, whose population of more than 20 million makes it Africas largest city.

title: Saving the A-10 Warthog
description: To the Editor:

title: Goodness and Power
description: There was an interesting poll result about Hillary Clinton last week. According to a Quinnipiac poll, 60 percent of independent voters believe that she has strong leadership qualities. But when these same voters were asked if she is honest and trustworthy, the evaluations flipped. Sixty-one percent said she is not honest and trustworthy. Apparently there are a lot of Americans who believe that Hillary Clinton is dishonest and untrustworthy but also a strong leader.

title: Out of Vietnam: Adoptee Grateful to Be an American
description: To the Editor:

title: Richard Holbrookes Diary of His Diplomacy
description: To the Editor:

title: When Deadbeat Dads Are Jailed
description: To the Editor:

title: Its O.K. to Laugh at Hitler
description: To the Editor:

title: Europes Google Problem
description: Have you heard the term Gafa yet? It hasnt caught on here in the United States  and Im guessing it wont  but in France, it has become so common that the newspapers hardly need to spell out its meaning. Everyone there already knows what Gafa stands for: Google-Apple-Facebook-Amazon.

title: New Yorks Unfair Summons System
description: The New York Police Department has long argued that the drop in crime in recent years could be attributed, in part, to the departments tough stance on nuisance offenses. But theres evidence that crime also went down in cities that did not take a similar zero tolerance approach to minor crimes.

title: Preparing for Warfare in Cyberspace
description: The Pentagons new 33-page cybersecurity strategy is an important evolution in how America proposes to address a top national security threat. It is intended to warn adversaries  especially China, Russia, Iran and North Korea  that the United States is prepared to retaliate, if necessary, against cyberattacks and is developing the weapons to do so.

title: The Trader as Scapegoat
description: A BRITISH trader, Navinder Singh Sarao, is facing extradition to the United States. Federal prosecutors accuse him of having significantly contributed to the flash crash of May 6, 2010, in which major American stock markets plunged dramatically in a matter of minutes. Prosecutors also say that he manipulated prices on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange for years by spoofing, or placing orders that he intended to cancel before they were filled.

title: The James Dean Movie That Explains the Greek Debt Negotiations
description: If you are the finance minister of a country, and word goes out that your role in crucial negotiations is being reduced, and your countrys cost to borrow plummets, it is not generally seen as an endorsement of your skills. It is the government equivalent of a corporate chief executive resigning and the companys stock soaring.

title: Banco Santanders Profit Rises 32 Percent, Fueled by Recovery in Spain
description: LONDON  Banco Santander of Spain reported on Tuesday that its first-quarter profit rose 32 percent as it benefited from Spains improving economy and depreciation in the euro.

title: Beijing Police Recommend Charges Against Civil Society Advocates
description: The Beijing Public Security Bureau has recommended that prosecutors indict Guo Yushan and He Zhengjun, two leading members of an independent economics and education think tank, on charges of illegal business activity, according to lawyers and a copy of the police document.

title: With Pope Franciss Encyclical on Climate Change Done, Now a Vatican Sales Push  and Pushback
description: The much-anticipated environmental encyclical that Pope Francis plans to issue this summer is already being translated into the worlds major languages from the Latin final draft, so theres no more tweaking to be done, several people close to the process have told me in recent weeks.

title: BP and Total Report Earnings Declines as Falling Oil Prices Hurt Profits
description: LONDON  The slump in oil prices continued to erode the profit of European oil companies, as results from BP of Britain and Total of France showed on Tuesday. But at both companies, the declines were offset by strong performances at their marketing and refining businesses.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Baltimore Police Clash With Youths After Funeral for Freddie Gray
description: In Morning Brings Wail of Fire Engines in Wake of Baltimore Riots, Sheryl Gay Stolberg reports on unrest in Baltimore on Monday.

title: Test Yourself | The Worlds Longest Yard Sale
description: Below, all six paragraphs of From Michigan to Alabama, a 690-Mile Yard Sale, a short article that accompanies the video, above.

title: Major Supreme Court Cases in 2015
description: How the court decided in key cases during the 2014-15 term.

title: A Narrow Escape
description: A social activist helps win a pardon for a condemned killer, who tries to use his second chance to rebuild his life.

title: 2% Inflation Rate Target Is Questioned as Fed Policy Panel Prepares to Meet
description: WASHINGTON  The cardinal rule of central banking, in the United States and in most other industrial nations, is that annual inflation should run around 2 percent.

title: Mayweather-Pacquiao Is an Easy Sell;Boxing Isnt
description: LAS VEGAS  As far as fights of the century go, Saturdays bout between Floyd Mayweather Jr. and Manny Pacquiao seemingly has it all, with two fighters with contrasting personalities, considered the best pound-for-pound boxers of their generation, meeting for the first time.

title: Hoping to Resuscitate a Portion of the Citys Heart
description: ATLANTA  There was a time in the 1960s when Underground Atlanta, a 12-acre complex of viaducts and storefronts in the heart of downtown, was billed as this citys answer to Bourbon Street. In the 1980s, it was reimagined as a tourist-friendly festival marketplace full of novelty retailers angling to attract out-of-town conventioneers. When that idea faltered, there was talk of turning it into a casino.

title: Islanders Fans Feel a Double Loss: Its Over for Nassau Coliseum, Too
description: COMMACK, N.Y.  About 26 miles east of an eerily silent Nassau Coliseum, Islanders fans packed Millers Ale House on Monday, hoping for another dramatic victory in Game 7 of their teams first-round playoff series against the Capitals.

title: A Narrow Escape
description: In the second of two episodes examining the criminal justice system in Iran, Thomas Erdbrink discusses the power of forgiveness with Sharmin Meymandinejad, a social activist, and Safar Angouti, the condemned killer Mr. Meymandinejad helped save from execution.

title: Whats at Stake in the Supreme Courts Gay-Marriage Case
description: The United States Supreme Court will hear arguments today in Obergefell v. Hodges, a case that could determine whether same-sex marriage is a constitutional right. (Times reporters are live blogging the proceedings here.) Emily Bazelon, a staff writer for the magazine, and Adam Liptak, The Timess Supreme Court correspondent, have been exchanging emails about the possible outcomes of the case and what they might mean for the gay rights movement.

title: Casting Early Presidential VoteThrough Facebook by Clicking Unfollow
description: WASHINGTON  The arguments on Facebook regarding Hillary Rodham Clintons announcement that she was running for president began politely at first but slowly grew more vitriolic with each back and forth.

title: Wang Jianlin, a Billionaire at the Intersection of Business and Power in China
description: HONG KONG  He controls thousands of movie screens around the world, serving more filmgoers than any other cinema chain. He has invested billions of dollars in real estate projects across four continents. He is building skyscrapers that will redraw the skylines of London and Chicago. He is shopping for a Hollywood studio.

title: Gay Marriage Arguments Divide Supreme Court Justices
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday was deeply divided over one of the great civil rights issues of the age, same-sex marriage. But Justice Anthony M. Kennedy, whose vote is probably crucial, gave gay rights advocates reasons for optimism based on the tone and substance of his questions.

title: Do You Care What You Wear?
description: Do you try hard to wear whats in style? Or do you make your own style? Or maybe you just dont care much at all  as long as the clothing is comfortable?

title: Jon Krakauers Missoula, About Rape in a College Town
description: Three years ago, a young woman befriended by the powerhouse author Jon Krakauer and his wife told them she had been raped when she was a teenager by a boy she knew and, later, for a second time, by a family friend. She was still struggling to recover. She gobbled Adderall to stay awake and guzzled alcohol to fall asleep, Krakauer writes. It was an unconscious attempt to annihilate herself.

title: Ordinary Light: A Memoir, by Tracy K. Smith
description: In The Souls of Black Folk (1903), W.E.B. DuBois defined the double consciousness of the African-American, the peculiar sensation of always looking at ones self through the eyes of others, of measuring ones soul by the tape of an alien world. The African-American ever feels his or her two-ness, two souls, two thoughts, two unreconciled strivings; two warring ideals in one dark body. Segregation placed a veil between the black observer and that other world, the white one. DuBoiss description of the black individual who is yet American remained apt into the era of increased integration, as shown in various autobiographies that began to appear in the 1990s by young black people who had entered the middle class. The experience of an elite school or a profession was understood as a leaving of the black world. Now we are hearing from the children of those black parents who rent the veil. For them, the Huxtable generation, whiteness may no longer be synonymous with what it is to be American or normal, but to be black still means knowing how to survive on what DuBois elsewhere identified as the island within.

title: Driven | 2015 Land Rover Discovery Sport
description: Most Land Rovers will live out their days on the pavement, but features packed into the Discovery Sport allow it to play off road when it needs to.

title: Video Review: The Land Rover Discovery Sport Is Meant to Get Muddy
description: MORE than most automotive brands, Land Rover navigates a narrow trail. While Audi, BMW and Mercedes sell a menagerie of sedans, convertibles, coupes and crossovers, Land Rover offers one thing: capable sport utility vehicles. Even the urbane Evoque has mountain goat DNA.

title: Who Owns Shares in Wang Jianlins Empire? Names Are Just a Start
description: Up a dark stairwell on the sixth floor of a decrepit building near the Workers Stadium in Beijing is a door covered with notices. One demands payment for two years of garbage collection fees. Another from the water company says a worker could not enter the apartment to check the meter because no one was home.

title: Scenes From the Unrest in Baltimore
description: A turbulent day in Baltimore ended with rioting by rock-throwing youths and a call to end the violence by religious leaders and the mother of Freddie Gray.

title: A Kindred Spirit to Share the Road
description: Asked by his wife what he learned after traveling in France with F. Scott Fitzgerald, Ernest Hemingway replied: Never to go on trips with anyone you do not love.

title: 1939: Jackie Robinson, Football Star
description: This feature looks at some of the earliest mentions of famous names or terms in The Times. Have an idea for someone or something you would like to read about? Send a suggestion in the comments section.Hell forever be known as the man who integrated Major League Baseball, but it was his prowess on the football field that brought Jackie Robinson to the attention of Times readers on Oct. 8, 1939 (though he was identified as Jack):

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: New York Today: Encyclopedia Bodega
description: Good morning on this mottled Tuesday.

title: Q. and A.: Ma Jun on Using Mobile Phones to Fight Pollution
description: Ma Jun, a former journalist who has become one of Chinas most prominent environmentalists, was recently honored with a Skoll Award for Social Entrepreneurship for the work of his nongovernmental organization, the Institute of Public and Environmental Affairs, in increasing awareness about sources of pollution in China.

title: Daily Report: Twitters New Features, and Old Problem
description: Twitters chief executive, Dick Costolo, has begun to follow through on his promise to reboot the company after the executive turmoil and product paralysis that dominated 2014, Vindu Goel reports.

title: Standard Chartered Profit Declined 22 Percent in First Quarter
description: LONDON  The British bank Standard Chartered, which generates most of its earnings in Asia, said on Tuesday that its profit had declined 22 percent in the first quarter. The bank cited an exit from some business lines, an increase in impairments for bad loans and challenging trading conditions, particularly in currency-hedging products.

title: Why Natural Doesnt Mean Anything Anymore
description: It isnt every day that the definition of a common English word that is ubiquitous in common parlance is challenged in federal court, but that is precisely what has happened with the word natural. During the past few years, some 200 class-action suits have been filed against food manufacturers, charging them with misuse of the adjective in marketing such edible oxymorons as natural Cheetos Puffs, all-natural Sun Chips, all-natural Naked Juice, 100 percent all-natural Tyson chicken nuggets and so forth. The plaintiffs argue that many of these products contain ingredients  high-fructose corn syrup, artificial flavors and colorings, chemical preservatives and genetically modified organisms  that the typical consumer wouldnt think of as natural.

title: The Pregnant Therapist
description: Olivia sat across from me in my sunlit office, shadowed in grief. Shed been trying to get pregnant for years, and had been coming to see me for nearly all of them. After three miscarriages and two unsuccessful IVFs, she spoke softly of her strained marriage, wringing her hands in her lap. I shifted my weight from one leg to the other, listening intently; she shifted her eyes toward the window. But no amount of diversion could hide what sat between us: my unmistakably pregnant belly.

title: Who Gets to Wear Shredded Jeans?
description: Recently I scanned the statement of authenticity on a brand-new pair of good old bluejeans. Printed on the inside of the left pocket, beneath an equine insignia, an 1873 patent date and a boast of its status as an American tradition, symbolizing the vitality of the West, Levi Strauss & Company reissued its ancient invitation to inspect the dry goods: We shall thank you to carefully examine the sewing, finish and fit. The fit was slim, the sewing sound, the finish glamorously traumatized, as if intending homage to clothes Steve McQueen might have worn home from a bike crash.

title: Franchising a Student Digital Privacy Law
description: As a reporter who covers tech industry data-mining practices, Ive received my fair share of there-oughta-be-a-law-against-that calls and emails from outraged readers.

title: In Performance: Rene Fleming and Douglas Sills of Living on Love
description: This weeks video features a scene with Rene Fleming and Douglas Sills of Joe DiPietros Living on Love, a new Broadway comedy, based on the play Peccadillo by Garson Kanin, about the romantic shenanigans of an opera star and her egomaniacal husband. In this excerpt, the opera diva Raquel De Angelis (Ms. Fleming, in her Broadway debut) gives her husband, the conductor Vito De Angelis (Mr. Sills), a snow globe she got for him during a visit to Vienna. But along with the gift she has a question: did he keep his promise to have no more extracurricular romances, no more peccadilloes while she was on tour? The show, directed by Kathleen Marshall, announced today that it will close on Sunday at the Longacre Theater after not receiving any Tony Award nominations.

title: Morning Agenda: What Makes a Mogul
description: WHAT MAKES A MOGUL | On the question-and-answer website Quora, someone recently posed a question that reflected many entrepreneurs aspirations: How can I be as great as Bill Gates, Steve Jobs, Elon Musk, Richard Branson? In the answers that followed, one users comments stood out because of her unique perspective, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in the DealBook column. As the first wife of Elon Musk, the founder of Tesla and Space X, Justine Musk personally witnessed the making of a mogul and had a front-row view of his similarly successful friends. Honest insights about what makes the most successful tick are hard to come by, Mr. Sorkin writes, which is why Ms. Musks posts over the past few weeks have been widely disseminated.

title: Today in Politics: Baltimore Riots and Same-Sex Marriage Share Center Stage
description: Good Tuesday morning from Washington. The presidential campaigns continue, but all focus is on the Supreme Court as it takes up the issue of same-sex marriage, and on Baltimore, which is reeling from riots and looting after the funeral of Freddie Gray, a 25-year-old black man who died in police custody.

title: Nepal Searches for Survivors After Earthquake
description: Officials in Nepal said most of the deaths were in and around the capital, but the quake touched a vast expanse of the subcontinent.

title: Sex Ed in an App?
Rent-a-Foreigner in China
description: In this short documentary, housing developers in China hire ordinary foreigners to pose as celebrities, boosting flagging property sales.

title: Rent-a-Foreigner in China
description: In China, its hard to find a city that has not built ambitious new districts on its rural periphery. But overbuilding has led to ghost towns: Towering rows of luxury apartments sit completely empty, especially in smaller cities in Chinas hinterlands. The lifeless streets seem to contradict official claims that these new developments will become booming, globalized cities.

title: Crowds Scatter as Baltimore Curfew Takes Hold
description: BALTIMORE  Armored vehicles lined this battered citys main thoroughfares and thousands of law enforcement officers and National Guard troops worked to maintain order and enforce a citywide curfew Tuesday night, amid scattered reports of unrest after a day of largely peaceful protests.

title: Rand Paul, in Iowa, Courts a College Crowd
description: In a Republican field so crowded that 10 or more candidates could be on the ballot for the Iowa caucuses, Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky is counting on the calendar to provide him an edge.

description: We are honoring each of the Top 10 winners of our Second Annual Student Editorial Contest by publishing an essay a day, in the order of submission.

title: Weekly News Quiz | April 21-27, 2015
description: Have you been following the news?

title: Dont Say, I Promise ; A Foster Child Joins a Family
description: He bumped into the little table and a round, ceramic candle holder rolled, dropped and shattered. Pieces scattered across the floor.

title: Why a Ruling for Same-Sex Marriage Would Help Republicans
description: Many Republicans believe that their party needs to improve its image among the new generation of young and nonwhite voters who have helped President Obama win two terms. Yet there is a reason most Republican politicians have not tailored their positions on major issues toward younger voters: Doing so would risk angering the partys base, which is predominantly old, white and culturally conservative.

title: Bright Passages
description: Its time for a short break from faultfinding. Heres a small sampling of sparkling prose from recent editions. The ingredients are familiar but always welcome: fresh, arresting descriptions; sharp details; varied sentence length and structure; and flashes of humor.

description: To Indulge: Dessert Operation Is Made to Order

title: Frustration Grows in Nepal as Earthquake Relief Trickles In
description: KATMANDU, Nepal  Residents of Katmandu living in tent camps after Nepals powerful earthquake said on Tuesday that their biggest worry was a lack of safe drinking water, even as they endured the latest pelting of rain.

title: Lining Up, Early, for Same-Sex Marriage Arguments at Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  The line outside the Supreme Court building on Tuesday snaked down the street and around the block. Many had waited for days to hear oral arguments on whether there is a constitutional right to same-sex marriage, and by sunrise, they shivered in the cool air as they hoped to catch a glimpse of history.

title: Tyson to End Use of Human Antibiotics in Its Chickens by 2017
description: Tyson Foods, one of the countrys largest meat producers, said on Tuesday that it planned to eliminate the use of human antibiotics in its chicken production by 2017.

title: A Visit From My Housekeeper
description: Dear Diary:

title: Prabal Gurung Brings Fashion to the Aid of Nepal
description: Prabal Gurung, the 36-year-old New York-based Nepalese designer, is generally known more for his dresses worn by Michelle Obama and the Duchess of Cambridge than for his activist inclinations.

title: Indonesia Executes 8, Including 7 Foreigners, Convicted on Drug Charges
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Defying international condemnation and rejecting 11th-hour pleas for clemency, the Indonesian government executed eight drug convicts after midnight on Wednesday, including seven foreigners.

description: Nominations for the 69th Tony Awards were announced on Tuesday morning in New York. Visit The New York Times Tonys live blog for complete coverage.

description: Scenes from nominated musicals and plays.

title: 2015 Tony Award Nominations
description: Click here for more coverage of the 2015 Tony Awards nominations.

title: Tsipras Signals Possible Greek Referendum on Credit Deal
description: ATHENS  Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece said on Tuesday that he might resort to calling a public referendum on any deal with the countrys international creditors if the package seems to go beyond the political mandate that brought his leftist government into power.

title: Whats It Like Reading Saul Bellows Henderson the Rain King Today?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. Saul Bellows Henderson the Rain King divided critics when it was first published in 1959. James Parker and Francine Prose discuss the experience of reading the novel today.

title: Gambling Comes to E-Sports With Unikrn
description: SEATTLE  Competitive video-game playing, known as e-sports, has passed many milestones to mainstream acceptance. Tens of thousands of spectators cram into sports arenas to watch competitions live, and millions more do so online through services like Twitch. ESPN has even broadcast games competitions.

title: Head of R.B.S. Spinoff, Williams & Glyn, to Step Down
description: LONDON  The Royal Bank of Scotland said on Tuesday that John Maltby would step down as chief executive of Williams & Glyn, the unit it plans to spin off by the end of next year.

title: Less Noise but More Money in Data Science
description: The outlook for data scientists: less hype, more hiring.

title: Highlights from the Supreme Courts Arguments on Same-Sex Marriage
description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday heard arguments on whether there is a constitutional right to same-sex marriage, the last public step before a decision, expected in June. The Times provided updates, analysis and reaction throughout the day.

title: Kill the Lights, Not the Birds
description: As many as a billion birds die each year in this country as they attempt to follow their seasonal routes  flying north in summer months, south in winter. Because many songbirds, sea birds, and other avians rely on stars to navigate, they grow confused by artificial lights. As a result, these birds die in droves as their ancient routes are interrupted by tall, brightly lit, glass buildings.

title: Lafayette Sails Back to New-York Historical Society, 200 Years Later
description: The Marquis de Lafayette paid a call at the New-York Historical Society in 1824, as part of a triumphant return trip to the country he had first visited as a 19-year-old soldier eager to help with the cause of American independence.

title: Fatal Shooting Outside Brooklyn Church Was Set Off by Longtime Dispute, Police Say
description: Shell casings fell one after another on the Brooklyn pavement and in the vestibule of a church where mourners had gathered for a wake. Twenty-eight rounds were fired by at least two gunmen as years-old animosity boiled over on Monday night.

title: 1915: Ship Is Sunk by Austrian Submarine
description: LONDON  The story of the sinking of the Lon-Gambetta has reached here in telegrams from Brindisi. The disaster occurred at half-past one in the morning [April 28] when the vessel was about twenty-five miles off Cape Santa Maria di Leuca, forming the heel of the Italian boot. The hostile craft was the Austrian submarine U6. Two torpedoes were fired, both of which struck the cruiser on the port side. The sunken vessel carried 714 men and 22 officers, which makes the number of those lost 600.  The New York Herald, European edition, April 29, 1915

title: First Draft Focus: Abe and Obama
Live Nation Takes Control of Bonnaroo Festival
description: For the music world, outdoor festivals are a big business that is only getting bigger. And the worlds largest concert conglomerate is getting a bigger piece of it.

title: Taking the Kids, for Nearly 20 Years
description: Family travel blogs may be ubiquitous today, but the subject of family travel was relatively virgin terrain when the journalist Eileen Ogintz, then on the staff of The Chicago Tribune, took her first assignment on the subject in 1987.

title: Trader Convicted of Insider Trading Receives More Prison Time
description: LONDON  A former trader convicted three years ago in an insider trading case has been ordered to serve additional prison time after failing to repay money obtained as a result of the trading, British regulators said on Tuesday.

title: Snapshots of How Politicians Have Evolved on Crime
description: A generation after presidential candidates competed to be tough on crime, a new crop of declared and presumed candidates is competing to rein in the mass incarceration of the last few decades.

description: Each Tuesday, The Upshots newsletter will feature a selection of comments from an article that resonated with our readers in the past week.

description: The Fishermans Son, a book and film by Chris Malloy, follows Ramn Navarros advocacy on behalf of Punta de Lobos, Chile.

description: Protesters on both sides of the issue gathered outside the Supreme Court on Tuesday as justices prepared to hear cases that could make same-sex marriage legal throughout the United States.

title: Google Reaches Out to European Publishers, With $165 Million in Hand
description: Google seems to have a new strategy in Europe: If you dont like the message, try to befriend the messengers.

title: U.S. Sends Destroyer After Iran Detains Ship
description: WASHINGTON  The United States Navy sent a destroyer toward the Persian Gulf on Tuesday after Iran took control of a Marshall Islands-flagged cargo ship it accused of trespassing in territorial waters, American military officials said.

title: Mintons
description: A culinary renaissance for a historic jazz club in Harlem.

title: Restaurant Review: Mintons in Harlem
description: The revolution ran on grits, ham hocks, ribs, black-eyed peas and biscuits.

title: On Gay Marriage, Views of G.O.P. Presidential Field Can Vary
description: Republican presidential candidates, and those still considering running, will be listening closely to the arguments on same-sex marriage that the Supreme Court is hearing.

title: 1965: Caviar, Yes, Kilowatts, No
description: MOSCOW  Caviar is as important as kilowatts in the construction of Communism, the Soviet government has decided. So a previously announced new power station on the lower Volga River will not be built and thus the favorite spawning grounds of the last of the worlds reserves of sturgeon will not be disturbed.

title: Air Pollution Tied to Brain Aging
description: Air pollution is known to increase the risk for stroke and other cerebrovascular disorders. But now researchers have found it is also linked to premature aging of the brain.
