description: Powerful Earthquake Strikes Nepal

title: Death Toll Mounts in Nepal
description: Death Toll Mounts in Nepal

title: Excerpts From the Supreme Court Same-Sex Marriage Arguments
description: The Supreme Court heard arguments Tuesday on two questions about states allowing same-sex couples to marry.

title: A Vatican Declaration Seeks Equitable Clean-Energy Access in a Livable Climate
description: A daylong Vatican meeting on climate, energy, ecology and equity has produced a declaration that offers a promising vision for religious and secular leaders eager to foster a sustainable human journey. The event, attended by dozens of religious leaders, scientists, social and environmental campaigners and others, is part of Pope Franciss campaign ahead of the release of his encyclical on the environment and equity. Read more in my initial post.

title: A New Film Follows a Pro Surfers Efforts to Save His Hometown Waves
description: About a three-hour drive from the capital city of Santiago, Chile, sits the small, quiet surfing and fishing town of Punta de Lobos, on a uniquely rugged stretch of coastline reminiscent of Northern Californias and Oregons. Dotted with tall cliffs, pine trees, cacti, massive rocks, cold Pacific water and rich fauna, its also legendary in surf lore for its famed left-hand point break.

title: Orioles to Play Wednesday, but Game Will Be Closed to Fans
description: The Baltimore Orioles will play Wednesdays game against the Chicago White Sox, but will not admit any fans amid unrest in the city, the team announced Tuesday.

title: April Bloomfields A Girl and Her Greens Delights in the Details
description: Before buying April Bloomfields new cookbook, A Girl and Her Greens, ask yourself these tough questions:

title: Gurlitt Art Trove Faces a New Legal Challenge
description: BERLIN  A relative of Cornelius Gurlitt who claims she should inherit works from his vast art collection is appealing a Munich courts rejection of her legal challenge, again throwing open the fate of a trove that includes works by Matisse, Gauguin, Renoir and Otto Dix. Mr. Gurlitt had bequeathed his collection to the Kunstmuseum Bern in Switzerland, and the court ruled last month that the works should go there.

title: DuPont Shareholders Can Afford to Give Nelson Peltz a Board Seat
description: DuPont shareholders can afford to give the billionaire activist Nelson Peltz a chance.

title: Big City Book Club Discusses The Island at the Center of the World
description: The Big City Book Club is discussing Russell Shortos best-selling and lively history of Dutch settlement in New York, The Island at the Center of the World below in the comments section. This time around, readers were asked to nominate the selection for the club, and Mr. Shortos book was selected after a close vote last month. Happily, the author is on hand to converse with us. Read the review of the book that appeared in The New York Times in 2004 and join us with questions and comments.

title: Aftermath of Unrest in Baltimore
description: Baltimore residents began clearing debris on Tuesday after a night of rioting, arson and looting that followed Freddie Grays funeral.

title: In Puerto Rico, Jeb Bush Says He Lives the Immigrant Experience
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.  Jeb Bush visited Puerto Rico on Tuesday and spoke in personal terms about the power of the immigrant experience as he challenged his party to be more respectful of Latino communities if it ever hopes to win back their votes.

title: With an Activists Death, Pakistans Violence Continues
description: In Pakistan and elsewhere around the globe, many people are asking who killed Sabeen Mahmud, the Pakistani activist, and what authorities will do about it.

title: Verbatim: Obama Calls for Soul Searching on Violence
description: President Obama, giving extended remarks during a press conference with Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, about the social forces that have led to clashes between the police and communities in places like Baltimore. He called on Americans to do some soul searching over the roots of such conflicts.

title: Across Nepals Countryside, Desperate Journeys to Ruined Homes After Quake
description: RAMCHE, Nepal  Madhu Badu had been on the road for the better part of three days, trying to get back to his native village, back to his wife and children, near the epicenter of Nepals devastating earthquake northwest of Katmandu. His journey had begun on a bus, but the roads had become impassable and now he was on foot.

title: After Much Criticism, N.F.L.s League Office Drops Tax-Exempt Status
description: The N.F.L.s league office will drop its tax-exempt status, which is decades old, in response to critics, including some members of Congress, who say that the government is losing millions of dollars in potential revenue.

title: Attorney General Eric Holders Mixed Scorecard
description: With Loretta E. Lynch sworn in as the new attorney general, we can look back at the legacy of Eric H. Holder Jr., who had the third-longest term in that office in American history. In the area of white-collar crime, the reaction to his leadership of the Justice Department has been mixed, with questions raised about whether too much emphasis was put on penalizing organizations at the expense of pursuing cases against individuals.

title: Northern Cooking
description: Chefs from New England up through the Maritime Provinces of Canada and west to Toronto and Montreal bring new energy to a regional cuisine.

title: Giving Northern Cuisine Its Due
description: WHITEWAY, Newfoundland  Jeremy Charles tipped a frying pan over a flame and spooned hot butter on some scallops.

title: President Obama Condemns Both theBaltimore Riots and the Nations Slow-Rolling Crisis
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama responded with passion and frustration on Tuesday to the violence that has rocked Baltimore and other cities after the deaths of young black men in confrontations with the police, calling for a period of soul-searching about what he said had become a near-weekly cycle of tragedy.

title: Witness Videos on Everest After Quake
description: A compilation of witness videos shows the frantic moment Saturdays earthquake touched off an avalanche at Mount Everest and the days after as rescue crews tried to reach survivors.

title: Reaction to South Korea Ferry Verdict
description: Relatives of the victims in South Koreas ferry disaster expressed discontent on Tuesday after an appeals court sentenced the captain to life in prison and issued a reduced sentence for the crew.

title: Turmoil in Baltimore Provides Immediate Test for New Attorney General
description: WASHINGTON  As he prepared to swear in Loretta E. Lynch as attorney general on Monday, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. said she was uniquely qualified to bridge the divide between minority neighborhoods and police officers clashing over the use of deadly force.

title: Council Set to Create a Cultural Plan for New York City
description: New York City is looking to join Chicago, Houston, Denver and other major cities by passing legislation to create its first comprehensive cultural plan.

title: VSPs versus MSEs
description: Simon Wren-Lewis tries to put his finger on something Ive also been trying to get at  the sharp difference between what influential people think they know about economics and what people who actually study the economy think they know. My take may be slightly different at the margin, but I do believe that its important.

title: Enchiladas, Light Yet Satisfying
description: Lightness is not an attribute usually associated with enchiladas, the most comforting of Mexican tortilla foods. But these enchiladas, filled with a mix of blanched seasoned chard and succulent diced chayote and covered with a classic cooked tomatillo salsa, are both light and incredibly satisfying.

title: 17-Year-Old to Become First Female Yeshiva Graduate Entering West Point
description: GREAT NECK, N.Y.  When Rachelle David applied for admission to the yeshiva high school here, her interviewer wrote in his notes: This girl is going to be a general in the army someday.

title: Scientists and Religious Leaders Discuss Climate Change at Vatican
description: VATICAN CITY  For a 2,000-year-old institution hardly known for its mutability, there was a sense of urgency at the Vatican on Tuesday when scientists, diplomats and religious and political leaders discussed climate change and its impact on the worlds poor.

title: Danny Meyer Moves In to New Whitney Museum
description: Headliner

title: What Are Your Favorite Streets in Europe?
description: As part of the Travel desks Favorite Streets in 12 European Cities, we asked readers on Facebook to share their favorite walks around Europe.

title: Courtney Love Is Sued by Co-Writer of Her Memoir
description: Courtney Love, a founding member of the band Hole and the widow of Kurt Cobain, has been sued by Anthony Bozza, the biographer she hired in 2010 to help write her memoir for William Morrow, an imprint of HarperCollins. The suit was filed Friday in Federal District Court for the Southern District of New York.

title: To Talk Baltimore With Kids, Focus on the Positive
description: Its not surprising that what is happening in Baltimore  which The Times is live-blogging here  seems more bleak, and more hopeless, than the protests in Ferguson. Baltimore is bigger, its problems arguably longer-standing  and these protests come after a series of similar protests that just arent bringing change fast enough. For families in some parts of Baltimore, these are scary times, for families in other parts, the disruption is just an inconvenience (and that dichotomy is part of the problem). For families in the rest of country, its another opportunity to talk about race, about racism, and about why there is so much anger.

title: No Excuse for Riots, Obama Says
description: The president said Tuesday that there was no excuse for the riots that took place in Baltimore on Monday night after protests against the death of a man in police custody turned violent.

title: Happy 100th Birthday, Film Studies
description: Long before the movies learned to talk, people began gathering in classrooms to talk about movies. This weekend the Columbia University Film Festival will mark the 100th anniversary of what appears to have been the first academic film-studies class  a Columbia adult-extension course called Photoplay Composition, offered beginning in 1915 in East Hall (now Maison Franaise), and including classroom study of dramatic structure and visits to local motion picture companies.

title: Saudi Arabia Accuses 93 of Terrorist Links, Including to ISIS
description: BEIRUT  Saudi Arabia has arrested 93 people accused of plotting terrorist attacks since December, including a group described as having sought to strike the United States Embassy with a car bomb, the Saudi Interior Ministry said on Tuesday.

title: Afghan Troops Rush to Kunduz Amid Taliban Assault
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan government has rushed thousands of troops to the northern province of Kunduz in recent days as a fierce Taliban offensive has surrounded the regional capital city, officials said.

title: Once Concerned, China Is Quiet About Trans-Pacific Trade Deal
description: WASHINGTON  As Congress debates the direction of economic policy in the Pacific, the main country worried about an American-led trade deal has gone nearly silent: China.

title: No Repeat of Riots, Governor Says
description: Gov. Larry Hogan of Maryland said Tuesday that more National Guard troops had been called up to restore calm in Baltimore after a night of rioting.

title: Darrelle Revis Is Upbeat About His Return, and Jets Secondary
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Before Todd Bowles presided over his first practice as Jets coach, a session held in T-shirts and shorts that later prompted him to quip that the team could probably function in a touch-football league, Darrelle Revis harked back to the most recent successful era in franchise history.

title: Protests in Baltimore
description: Baltimore residents began clearing debris on Tuesday after a night of rioting, arson and looting that followed Freddie Grays funeral.

title: Richard Trumka, A.F.L.-C.I.O. Chief, Warns Candidates on Inequality
description: Richard Trumka, the president of the A.F.L.-C.I.O., vowed Tuesday that organized labor would no longer accept cautious half-measures from presidential candidates about how to address economic fairness, an implicit but unmistakable attempt to nudge Hillary Rodham Clinton toward embracing a liberal agenda during her presidential run.

title: A Four-Bedroom Colonial House in Cartagena, Colombia
description: The house, which dates to around 1685 and has a pool, a roof terrace and a whirlpool, is on the market for $2.2 million.

title: John Slatterys Unsentimental Goodbye to Mad Men
description: As John Slattery chained his bike to a pole at the corner of Bank Street and Greenwich Avenue, a young woman stopped and did a double take.

title: Museum of Biblical Art to Close, Despite Recent Crowds
description: Since it opened in 2005 in a modest space at 61st Street and Broadway, the Museum of Biblical Art has been the little museum that could, the home of many highly focused, critically lauded shows that looked at Western art through the lens of the Bible and its legacy in Christian and Jewish tradition. Over the last two months, the museum has been drawing the largest crowds in its history for a curatorial coup, a show of sculpture by Donatello from the Duomo museum in Florence, pieces never before seen in the United States.

title: Twitter Earnings, Released Early, Disappoint Investors
description: SAN FRANCISCO  As Twitter has struggled to attract new users, the one bright spot has been its ability to wring more and more advertising dollars from marketing messages shown to the people on its service.

title: A Landmark Gay MarriageCase at the Supreme Court
description: The lawyers defending state bans on same-sex marriage before the Supreme Court Tuesday morning tried their best to put a friendly face on their arguments. But if anyone doubted the depth of the discrimination that gays and lesbians continue to face across America, an outburst partway through the arguments provided a bracing reminder.

title: History Says It Could Be Long Series as Rangers and Capitals Meet Again
description: A Rangers-Capitals playoff matchup has become a rite of spring in recent years. Their second-round N.H.L. playoff series, which begins Thursday, will be the teams fifth postseason meeting in seven years. Three of the four previous series have gone seven games. In the regular season, the Rangers had a 3-1 record against the Capitals, including a 4-2 victory in the season finale. Here is a look at the recent postseason history of the Rangers and the Capitals.

title: Yahoo Introduces 18 Digital Series at NewFronts
description: Internet companies and publishers are playing up their original programming and trotting out celebrities this week in an attempt to stoke advertiser interest in digital video.

title: Income Inequality Is Costing the U.S. on Social Issues
description: Thirty-five years ago, the United States ranked 13th among the 34 industrialized nations that are today in the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development in terms of life expectancy for newborn girls. These days, it ranks 29th.

title: Maestra, Psychological Thriller by L. S. Hilton, Scooped Up By G.P. Putnams Sons
description: G. P. Putnams Sons has scooped up North American publication rights to Maestra, a psychological thriller that has already been optioned by Columbia Pictures.

title: Winston-Salems 21st Century Business Park
description: Wake Forest Innovation Quarter repurposes an R.J. Reynolds Tobacco site into a center for technology business.

title: Technology Overtakes Tobacco in Winston-Salem, N.C.
description: WINSTON-SALEM, N.C.  The idea that universities and government could jointly build a business park framed around technology was born 55 years ago in North Carolina, on farm and forest land eight miles south of downtown Durham.

title: The Wild Ideas of Social Conservatives
description: Today the Supreme Court heardoral arguments on whether there exists aconstitutional right to same-sex marriage, with a conclusion that (notwithstanding some chin-strokingfrom Anthony Kennedy this morning) seems more or lessforegone. Among my fellow journalists and commentators, theres little remaining debate at all, in part because theres almost nobody left to have one, and in partbecause the winning sides theory of the case (that opposition equals bigotry) precludes sustained engagement with the few remaining non-converts to its cause. On this issue, social conservatives have basically experienced the oldfirst they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win process in reverse, and were somewhere between the laugh at you and the ignore you stages  though it remains to be seen whether then they fine you and tax you and try to shut you down will be the actual final step.

title: What You Get for  $2,500,000
description: An oceanfront house in Oregon, a bungalow in California and country club living in Louisiana

title: Review: The Merry Widow, Revisited at the Met
description: At its premiere on New Years Eve, the Metropolitan Operas new production of The Merry Widow, a dreary vehicle for Rene Fleming staged by the Broadway veteran Susan Stroman, made its title seem like a question. Merry? Really?

title: Met Museum to Expand Its Musical Offerings With New Breuer Space
description: The countertenor Anthony Roth Costanzo will sing a new monodrama based on Michelangelos love poems by the composer Suzanne Farrin in the Metropolitan Museum of Arts Renaissance-era Vlez Blanco Patio. Singers will offer Schubert lieder to museumgoers in certain galleries on certain days.

title: Carlyle Takes Stake in Brazilian Hospital Operator
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The Carlyle Group has obtained a minority stake in a hospital operator, Rede DOr So Luiz, for 1.75 billion reais or $603 million, its first private equity investment in Brazil since 2012.

title: A Conversation With Jared C. Kushner
description: Mr. Kushner, 34, is the chief executive of Kushner Companies, a developer that owns and operates more than 20,000 residential apartments nationwide in addition to about 12 million square feet of office, industrial and retail space. He is also the publisher of Observer Media, which owns The Commercial Observer newspaper, and the husband of Ivanka Trump.

title: As Celiac and Gluten Sensitivities Gain Prominence, Drug Companies Race to Find Treatments
description: Like many people with a sensitivity to gluten, Kristen Sweet avoids the protein in wheat that can make her sick. But when she eats at a friends house or a restaurant, she cannot be certain that the food is absolutely gluten-free.

title: War Stories Both Quiet and Loud
description: An occasional series on vintage comics.

title: Hats Off to Modern Milliners
description: For many, the word milliner evokes figures from a bygone era  antiquated artisans whose skill sets were passed down to them from earlier generations, and whose numbers have dwindled in recent decades. Today, their creations can come to define a person or look, like that vintage Vivienne Westwood hat has done for Pharrell Williams, or those Stephen Jones Millinery masterpieces have done for the Thom Browne runway. In our millinery program, were seeing a younger student who is really interested in the art of the hat, observes Ellen Goldstein, a professor of accessories design at F.I.T. for over 30 years and the founder of the schools accessories program. This is someone who is not looking to make just some hat, but to experiment with material, size and style to create that sculptural piece of art  like Gigi Burris, a young milliner who was among the CFDA/Vogue Fashion Fund nominees in 2014.

title: Review: Zachary Leaders The Life of Saul Bellow: To Fame and Fortune, 1915-1964
description: Saul Bellows mother, Liza, liked to use an old Yiddish metaphor to describe people whod had a lucky break. Theyve fallen into the schmaltz-grub, Bellow recalled her saying, a pit of fat.

title: Review: Australian Chamber Orchestra Plays Haydn and Mozart
description: Carnegie Hall probably could have presented the popular Australian Chamber Orchestra in Stern Auditorium, its main hall. But it was a treat to hear that ensemble play a wonderful concert on Sunday afternoon in the 600-seat Zankel Hall, Carnegies appealing basement performance space. In that setting, the symphonic grandeur and inventiveness of Haydns Symphony No. 83 in G minor, known as The Hen, came through with up-close immediacy, although the fleet, bold performance these impressive Australian musicians gave would have sounded great almost anywhere.

title: Sam Smith Cancels Australian Shows
description: Sam Smith, the Grammy-winning British singer known for his angelic voice and cherubic face, has canceled the remainder of his Australian tour, citing a hemorrhage on his vocal cords.

title: Bernard Sanders to Announce Presidential Bid
description: Senator Bernard Sanders, the independent from Vermont, plans to run for president as a Democrat, becoming the only official party challenger so far to Hillary Rodham Clinton.

title: Review: Shore, a Dance and More Over Space and Time
description: About a hundred people assembled at a basketball court on West 21st Street in Chelsea on Thursday night, huddled around a cardboard sign that read Gather Here. This was the starting point for Shore: Performance, one phase of the choreographer Emily Johnsons multipart, multicity project, Shore. Following Ms. Johnsons instructions to walk together and in silence, we made our way to New York Live Arts on West 19th Street, along the path (roughly) of what used to be Minetta Creek.

title: Pictures of the Day: Nepal and Elsewhere
description: Nepal and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Nepal Struggles to Cope With Aftermath of Earthquake
description: Claims of slow disaster relief have kindled growing public frustration here with the Nepalese government.

title: Review: The Casual Vacancy, Based on J. K. Rowlings Novel, on HBO
description: Oh to not be in England.

title: April 28, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Nepal, United States, Indonesia and Burundi.

title: A Vintage Times Square Hotel Gets More Modern
description: In 1999 when it opened, the Time Hotel on Times Square was among the first wave of design-centric hotels to hit the theater district. Now that subsequent waves have flooded the area with trendy options, the pioneer will undergo a thorough renovation, down to its logo.

title: Regions Bank Fined $7.5 Million for Illegal Overdraft Charges
description: Acting for the first time under rules intended to protect consumers from illegal bank overdraft charges, the federal government fined Regions Bank $7.5 million for charging overdraft fees without first getting customers permission.

title: Saudis Hit a Yemeni Airport, Possibly Closing Aid Route
description: SANA, Yemen  A Saudi-led military coalition carried out at least seven airstrikes on the international airport here on Tuesday, possibly crippling the airport in order to prevent an Iranian airplane from landing, according to Saudi and Yemeni officials.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Questioning of Garner Protesters in New York Renews Concerns About Police Practices
description: Last December, as people arrested during protests related to the death of Eric Garner waited to be released from Police Headquarters in Manhattan, an officer removed a 28-year-old woman from a holding cell there.

title: Review: In Iris, Albert Maysles Explores Iris Apfels Style
description: There are few better ways right now to spend 80 movie minutes than to see Iris, a delightful eye-opener about life, love, statement eyeglasses, bracelets the size of tricycle tires and the art of making the grandest of entrances. Directed by Albert Maysles  one half of the legendary documentary team that made Grey Gardens  this is a documentary about a very different kind of woman who holds your imagination from the moment she appears. You cant take your eyes off Iris Apfel (she wouldnt have it any other way), but, then, why would you want to?

title: Baltimore Symphony to Play Free Outdoor Concert Wednesday
description: The Baltimore Symphony Orchestra announced on Tuesday that its musicians would give a free concert in support of our community on Wednesday at noon outside its home at Joseph Meyerhoff Symphony Hall, a short drive from some of the citys worst looting.

title: Photographs of Earthquake Devastation in Nepal
description: When Nepal was hit with a powerful earthquake the tremor shattered lives, landmarks and the very landscape of the country. The scope of the disaster in photographs.

title: Recent Commercial Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Past and Present in a Vietnamese Village
description: Decades after an American medic made portraits of a villages children, a photographer tracks them down in todays Vietnam.

title: Review: Soul Boys of the Western World Revisits Spandau Ballet
description: Perfectly timed to coincide with Spandau Ballets current reunion tour, Soul Boys of the Western World is a cheekily self-serving account of the English groups rise to glory in the 1980s and its later dissolution. Working with only pre-existing footage, the director, George Hencken, constructs an unabashedly promotional tale of working-class aspiration and worldwide acclaim.

title: New York City F.C. Considers Building Stadium at Columbia Complex
description: Over the past four years, New York Citys $100 million professional soccer club has bounced from a pier on the Hudson River to a public park in Queens to a factory site in the South Bronx in its relentless search for a permanent home.

title: Nigeria Says It Rescued Hundreds From Suspected Boko Haram Territory
description: DAKAR, Senegal  The Nigerian Army contended on Tuesday that it had rescued hundreds of kidnapped girls and women from a remote region, even as new evidence of a mass killing by Boko Haram terrorists in northern Nigeria emerged, with numerous corpses discovered in a dry riverbed.

title: With a Fellow Latin American, Pope Francis Jokes About Argentine Vanity
description: After meeting Pope Francis at the Vatican on Tuesday, the president of Ecuador, Rafael Correa, told his two million Twitter followers that the pontiff had spoken enthusiastically about his coming visit to the country and had even told him a self-deprecating joke.

title: Sheldon Silver Pleads Not Guilty to Newest Charge
description: He appeared a bit more relaxed than he had at earlier courtroom appearances, his transition from longtime New York State Assembly speaker to criminal defendant perhaps becoming somewhat less jarring.

title: Bud Light Withdraws Slogan After It Draws Ire Online
description: A new label on some bottles of Bud Light, one of the brands owned by the beer giant Anheuser-Busch InBev, is falling flat among women, a demographic group the industry has been desperately courting in hopes of jump-starting flagging sales of suds.

title: In Baltimore, Were All Freddie Gray
description: BALTIMORE  AT the moment, whats going on in Baltimore seems to be all about Freddie Gray, the 25-year-old black man who was viciously attacked by police officers on April 12 more or less because he looked at them. They subdued him; his spine was nearly severed, his voice box was smashed and he was hauled off in a police van, even after he requested medical attention multiple times. He died a week later as result.

title: Takeda Agrees to Pay $2.4 Billion to Settle Suits Over Cancer Risk of Actos
description: Takeda Pharmaceutical has agreed to pay $2.4 billion to settle thousands of lawsuits from patients and their family members who said that the companys diabetes drug Actos caused bladder cancer, it announced on Tuesday.

title: Tony Nominations 2015: An American in Paris and Fun Home Emerge as Favorites
description: One show is elegant and nostalgic, powered by eye-popping ballet sequences and romantic Gershwin tunes. Another is a heart-rending look at a womans effort to better understand her identity and her upbringing. And the third is a riotous spoof, replete with bawdy jokes and over-the-top musical numbers.

title: Fewer Children Are Entering U.S. Illegally as Mexico Cracks Down, Analysis Finds
description: MEXICO CITY  A significant drop in the number of children apprehended at the United States-Mexico border in recent months sprang from Mexicos record number of deportations of minors traveling without a guardian, according to an analysis released Tuesday.

title: Charlie Baker to Join Clinton Campaign
description: Hillary Rodham Clintons presidential campaign has hired Charlie Baker, a veteran Boston-based political operative, as its chief administrative officer, two people briefed on the move said.

title: Cleaning Up Baltimore
description: After a night of violent clashes with the police, protests, vandalism and arson, Baltimore residents aim to put their city back together.

title: The Roots of the Rioting in Baltimore
description: To the Editor:

title: Floridas House Adjourns Early in Quarrel With Senate Over Medicaid
description: MIAMI  A fight over Medicaid expansion among Republicans in the Florida Legislature turned rancorous Tuesday after the House of Representatives adjourned three days early, leaving in limbo the states $77 billion budget, a trail of unfinished bills and an unresolved feud with the Senate over the federal program.

title: Brooklyn Academy of Music To Name New Space After Outgoing President
description: The Brooklyn Academy of Musics new space in a nearby mixed-use development will be named after Karen Brooks Hopkins, the outgoing president of the academy.

title: How Not to Report on an Earthquake
description: As of Tuesday morning, exactly three days have passed since a 7.8-magnitude earthquake shook Nepal, killing thousands and leaving millions in need of help. In disaster response, the end of the first 72 hours is often considered an inflection point: the unofficial moment when the most acute phase passes, the odds of finding trapped survivors plunge and the relief effort tends to really pick up steam.

title: Same City, but Very Different Life Spans
description: Researchers from Virginia Commonwealth University released life expectancy calculations for four cities, part of a broader series whose aim is to influence social policy.

title: Elizabeth Brown Pryor, Biographer of Clara Barton and Robert E. Lee, Dies at 64
description: Elizabeth Brown Pryor, a biographer and retired diplomat who drew on long-unseen documents to illuminate the lives of Clara Barton and Robert E. Lee, died on April 13 in a car crash in Richmond, Va. She was 64.

title: AOL and NBCUniversal Announce Partnership to Share and Develop Content
description: AOL and NBCUniversal will share content and develop programming together as part of a licensing and distribution agreement that the two companies announced on Tuesday.

title: Dutch Foreign Minister Reports Progress in Inquiry Into Downing of Malaysian Jetliner
description: Forensics experts have identified remains of 296 of the 298 people killed in the attack that downed a Malaysia Airlines jetliner last July in eastern Ukraine, the foreign minister of the Netherlands said Tuesday.

title: Auto Safety Regulator Pledges to Get Tough on Slow-Moving Recalls
description: WASHINGTON  In the sharpest comments of his young tenure as the nations top auto safety regulator, Mark R. Rosekind promised on Tuesday to take aggressive action on vehicle recalls that move too slowly and continue to endanger lives.

title: Food Fight on the Jury May Derail Code Trial
description: A dispute between two jurors  including an accusation of food tampering in the jury room  could prompt a mistrial in the criminal case against Sergey Aleynikov, the former Goldman Sachs programmer charged with stealing some of the firms high-frequency trading code.

title: Nepals Cultural Heritage Becomes Its Scrap as Human Crisis Takes Priority After Earthquake
description: KATMANDU, Nepal  On Katmandus Basantapur Durbar Square on Tuesday, a heavy wooden beam was slipping down what was left of the Maju Dega Temple.

title: Don Mankiewicz, Screenwriter in a Family Film Tradition, Dies at 93
description: Don Mankiewicz, an Oscar-nominated screenwriter and a member of the family dynasty that produced film classics like Citizen Kane, All About Eve and his own I Want to Live!, a weepy death-house drama starring Susan Hayward as a woman wrongfully accused of murder, died on Saturday at his home in Monrovia, Calif. He was 93.

title: Data Company Unearthed Twitters Earnings Early
description: Selerity, a financial analytics firm, recently released a study about how news events break on Twitter. On Tuesday, however, Selerity made news about Twitter.

title: Sexism and Anti-Semitism Charged in Al Jazeera America Lawsuit
description: Al Jazeera America, the cable network that started 20 months ago to great fanfare and with big budgets, came under fire on Tuesday after the network was sued by a former employee and lost two executives.

title: The Music Festival Business: Who Owns What
description: Consolidation in the concert business has resulted in many of the biggest outdoor festivals coming under the control of just a handful of companies. Here is a sampling of some of those events and the promoters that own them, either in full or in partnerships.

title: Former Resident Kills Director of Bronx Homeless Shelter, Police Say
description: A former resident of a Bronx homeless shelter returned there Monday night, abducted its director, forced her to undress in her car, chased her as she tried to flee and then shot her in the street, killing her, police officials said on Tuesday.

title: Aurora Shooting Victims Detail a Night of Terror at the Trial of James E. Holmes
description: CENTENNIAL, Colo.  The prosecutor had a simple question for Caleb Medley: Did you go to the Century 16 movie theater in Aurora, Colo., in July 2012?

title: What Came Before Baltimores Riots
description: The riots that devastated urban America during the 1960s were often ignited by acts of police brutality that inflamed poor African-American communities where the police were seen not as protectors but as an occupying force. These same tensions resurfaced last year in the suburban St. Louis community of Ferguson, Mo., where riots broke out after a white police officer shot and killed Michael Brown, a black teenager. They have now erupted on a larger stage, in Baltimore, after the death of Freddie Gray, a young black man who suffered a catastrophic injury while in police custody.

title: An Eroding Syrian Army Points to Strain
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Syrian Army has suffered a string of defeats from re-energized insurgents and is struggling to replenish its ranks as even pro-government families increasingly refuse to send sons to poorly defended units on the front lines. These developments raise newly urgent questions about the durability of President Bashar al-Assads rule.

title: Andrew Lesnie, Cinematographer of Lord of the Rings, Dies at 59
description: Andrew Lesnie, the Oscar-winning cinematographer who filmed Peter Jacksons Lord of the Rings trilogy and three Hobbit movies, died on Monday in Australia. He was 59.

title: A Squatters Last Stand at a Condemned Bronx Barn
description: Mark Stagg, a Westchester County developer, has become one of the busiest builders in the Bronx, with an ability to overcome various obstacles to his many projects.

title: No Deal, but Progress on Trans-Pacific Trade, Obama and Shinzo Abe Say After Meeting
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama visited Tokyo last year, a dinner that Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan had planned as a bonding session at a legendary sushi restaurant instead became a forum for haggling over tariff rates under a sweeping Pacific Rim trade agreement.

title: Sweeping Glass Off Their Streets,Baltimore Residents Discuss the Odds of Healing
description: BALTIMORE  The broken glass of the CVS pharmacy was mostly swept from the sidewalk. Across the street, Jas Beauty Mart was closed; a man and a little boy ate from a lunchbox while a police officer in riot gear stood watch a yard or two away.

title: E.U. Envisions Role for Iran in Peace Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS  The European Unions top diplomat said Tuesday evening that she hoped a final nuclear deal with Iran would clear the way for Tehran to play a major but positive role in the conflicts roiling the Middle East, particularly in Syria.

title: African Leaders Are Mute, Even as Their People Die at Sea
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Amid the global cries of alarm over the deaths of African migrants in the Mediterranean has been a notable silence: Where are the impassioned voices of African leaders who, arguably, could be shouting the loudest?

title: Call It Coincidence, or Corruption
description: In a fabulous coincidence, if you prefer fables to scandal, United Airlines started a twice-weekly, money-losing flight to Columbia, S.C., that just happened to be handy for a powerful public official in New Jersey who had a weekend home nearby in Aiken.

title: Baltimore Riots Are Another Scar on a City Long Battered by Neglect
description: BALTIMORE  The Rev. Donte L. Hickman Sr. heard about the trouble brewing on this citys west side on Monday afternoon and instantly took to Twitter to rally his East Baltimore troops.

title: Lively Morgue Tumblr 506  510
description: Lively Morgue Tumblr 506  510

title: Bruce Alger, 96, Dies; Led Mink Coat Protest Against Lyndon Johnson
description: Bruce Alger, a five-term conservative congressman from Texas who led elegantly dressed Republican women in a boorish protest against Lyndon B. Johnson in 1960 that backfired and may have cost Richard M. Nixon the state and the presidential election, died on April 13 in Palm Bay, Fla. He was 96.

title: Vikings Plan on Keeping Adrian Peterson, G.M. Insists
description: EDEN PRAIRIE, Minn.  For the first nine and a half minutes of a news conference previewing the N.F.L. draft, Minnesota Vikings General Manager Rick Spielman spoke at a lectern while occasionally glancing at a single sheet of notes, folded lengthwise, that he pulled from the pocket of his gray suit coat.

title: Geometrically Speaking
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Unlike Daniel Landman, todays constructor, I do not have fond memories of high school geometry. Maybe it was the way I was taught. Maybe I was distracted by teenage angst. All I know is that if someone, at one point in my schooling, taught me that ELK, EARL, LEAK and GEAR are standard naming conventions for POLYGONS, that moment has long since been dumped from my brain cells.

title: Voices From the Streets of Baltimore
description: The day after chaos erupted across Baltimore, people who were assembled near a looted CVS drugstore discussed the violence.

title: Marcel Pronovost, 84, Dies; Hall of Famer Shared in Five N.H.L. Titles
description: Marcel Pronovost, a slick-skating, tough-checking defenseman who played on five Stanley Cup championship teams and earned a place in the Hockey Hall of Fame, died on Sunday in Windsor, Ontario. He was 84.

title: Turkey: Armenian Church Seeks Headquarters Return
description: Lawyers for the Armenian Church said Tuesday that they had filed a lawsuit with Turkeys highest court seeking a return of the churchs headquarters, a sacred site in the south-central city of Kozan confiscated by the Ottoman authorities in 1915 as part of their broad repression of the Armenian Christian minority. About 1.5 million Armenians were killed during that era in what is now widely regarded as a genocide. The lawsuit, brought in the Constitutional Court of Turkey, is an unprecedented effort by the Armenian Church to use the Turkish legal system to recover property seized 100 years ago, said Payam Akhavan, a former prosecutor at The Hague and the churchs lead international counsel in the case. The suit, filed Monday, came a few days after Armenia officially commemorated the centennial of the genocide.

title: Millennia of Marriage Being Between Man and Woman Weigh on Justices
description: WASHINGTON  For thousands of years, in societies around the globe, marriage has meant the union of a man and a woman. And suddenly, said Justice Stephen G. Breyer, you want nine people outside the ballot box to change that by judicial fiat.

title: Assemblyman Scarborough to Step Down and Plead Guilty to Corruption Charges
description: ALBANY  Admitting that he claimed false travel expenses to pad his salary, a state assemblyman from Queens said on Tuesday that he would resign from office and plead guilty to corruption charges.

title: Reacting to Baltimore Rioting, M.L.B. and Teams Put Safety First
description: Every game in the history of Major League Baseball has been open to fans. That is what the league said on Tuesday, anyway, and it stands to reason. Baseball is a business, and every business needs paying customers.

title: Colombia: Officials Urge End to Herbicides Use on Coca
description: Colombias Health Ministry has recommended halting the spraying of an herbicide widely used in an American-funded campaign to eradicate crops of coca, the plant used to make cocaine. The recommendation, posted Tuesday on Twitter, was based on a recent finding by an agency of the World Health Organization that the herbicide, glyphosate, probably causes cancer in people. Glyphosate is widely used around the world by farmers to kill weeds and is the active ingredient in Roundup, made by Monsanto. The spraying campaign is controversial in Colombia, where it has long raised health and environmental concerns, angered farmers and drawn criticism from politicians on the left.

title: Martin OMalley Takes a Walking Tour of an Angry Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE  Martin OMalley may plan on being president, but early on Tuesday evening, he said, he just wanted to be present.

title: Tender Arm Lands Masahiro Tanaka on Disabled List; Yankees Top the Rays
description: It was around 2 p.m. Tuesday, several hours before the Yankees took the field against the Tampa Bay Rays, when an ominous sign emerged from the Yankees clubhouse. There stood Masahiro Tanaka, pointing toward his right wrist.

title: Jeb Bush Visits Puerto Rico in Hopes of Reconnecting With Hispanic Voters
description: BAYAMON, P.R.  Jeb Bush savored the scene. An adoring mob of several hundred selfie-hungry fans descended  hugging, kissing, jostling and stepping on him.

title: A Troubling Sign as the Yankees Ace Is Sidelined Again
description: The Yankees gave out Masahiro Tanaka bobblehead dolls Tuesday, celebrating the pitcher who electrified the major leagues early last season. The toy Tanaka is striding confidently toward the plate, his elbow cocked behind him, his hand gripping a four-seam fastball. That is the image the team wants to project of its ace.

title: Corker Stops Progress of Budget Deal, Even as Pressure for More Spending Builds
description: WASHINGTON  A single senator on Tuesday stopped the advance of a House-Senate agreement that would ostensibly deliver the first balanced budget of this century, but the deals fate faced far greater obstacles than just his objections. Even before its official unveiling, the agreement is already threatened with irrelevance amid a bipartisan clamor for more spending in a new era of loosening belts.

title: Rafael Montero Gets Call but Stumbles as Mets Lose to Marlins
description: MIAMI  Carlos Torres took the mound for the Mets in the eighth inning Tuesday with the score tied and the margin for error particularly thin.

title: Ryan McDonagh Grew Into Role as Rangers Captain
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  When Ryan McDonagh was named the captain of the Rangers in October, his goal was to remain unchanged as a player, a person and a leader in the dressing room.

title: Should I Lend Money to My Irresponsible Parents?
description: The ethicists answer reader questions about familial loans and writing a recommendation letter to keep a former student from being deported.

title: Massachusetts: Testimony on Boston Bombers Sister-In-Law
description: Katherine Russell, the wife of Tamerlan Tsarnaev, is emerging as an increasingly curious figure in the trial of her brother-in-law, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the convicted Boston Marathon bomber. Testimony on Tuesday showed that someone using her computer had searched to find out what benefits or rewards might accrue to the wife of mujahedeen, a holy warrior, or wife of a shahid, a martyr. On Monday, her best friend testified that after the 2013 marathon bombings, which killed three people, Ms. Russell noted in a text: A lot more people are killed every day in Syria plus other places. Prosecutors presented evidence earlier that the bombs were made in the Cambridge, Mass., apartment where Ms. Russell lived with Tamerlan, who was killed in a gun battle with the police, but she has not been identified as a witness for the government or the defense. She did not testify before the grand jury regarding the bombings; her lawyer has said she will not do so without immunity.

title: In the Midst of Tragedy, Creating an Album as a Form of Therapy
description: In the summer of 2008, MorganEve Swain, a pixie-ish, free-spirited fiddler and singer met David Lamb, a bearded, deeply feeling singer-songwriter, while touring on the East Coast. Just days later, Lamb asked Swain to join his eclectic folk ensemble Brown Bird. The pair fell in love, and over the course of six years  as Brown Bird whittled its lineup down to a duo  they would release four full-length albums, building a faithful following near their home in Warren, Rhode Island. Swaim and Lamb were married in August 2013. On April 5, 2014, Lamb died due to complications from leukemia.

title: U.S. Backs Private Bid for $125 Million for Rural Investment
description: Tom Vilsack, the secretary of agriculture, has traveled to New York and San Francisco, knocking on the doors of some of the countrys biggest investors, including BlackRock, Blackstone and GE Capital.

title: Word of the Day | importunate
description: importunate  \im-por-ch-nt, -tyu-nt\  adjective

title: King Salman of Saudi Arabia Names Mohammed bin Nayef Next in Line of Succession
description: BEIRUT  King Salman of Saudi Arabia issued a series of surprise royal decrees early Wednesday, shaking up the line of princes slated to succeed him to the throne, replacing a number of ministers and further enhancing the power of his own line.

title: Persistent Mayor Gets His Pick: N.F.L. Draft Comes to Chicago
description: CHICAGO  A pigskin wonderland was being raised in Grant Park early Tuesday ahead of the 80th N.F.L. draft. By Thursday evening, when Tampa Bay is expected to make the first selection, it will include flag football fields for children, a Selection Square where all 32 teams will set up shop and make their picks, and provisional studios for both ESPN and the NFL Network. Draft Town, as it has been named, will also come equipped with a bar and all manner of league merchandise for sale.

title: Nets, Exceeding Expectations Against Hawks, Stay Loose
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Nets spilled out of a conference room early Tuesday afternoon, many of them wearing T-shirts and jeans, and most were smiling as they prepared to head to the airport, where a chartered flight to Atlanta awaited.

title: A Globe-Trotter in the Kentucky Derby Gate
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  If Mubtaahij should become the first horse to journey from Dubai to win the Kentucky Derby, it would not be because everything before the race went according to plan.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 3:50 P.M. (MoreMax) TRANCE (2013) Danny Boyles thriller begins in an auction house, where a robbery leaves Simon (James McAvoy), an employee charged with safeguarding a Goya, with amnesia and unable to reveal where the painting is. Vincent Cassel plays Franck, the leader of the men behind the heist  and, it turns out, Simons business partner. And Rosario Dawson is the hypnotherapist who holds the key to Simons memory. Mr. Boyle, as always, works hard to cast a spell in Trance, and his energy and commitment to the audiences entertainment are evident in every scene, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times about this film from the director of Trainspotting and Slumdog Millionaire. But there are times when it feels as if hes throwing everything at the screen  the throbbing music, bleeding fingers, narrative U-turns and the startling sight of a naked Ms. Dawson striding toward the camera as strategically shorn as a Renaissance nude  less because he wants to distract you from the big reveal than to obscure the materials thinness. She added, That doesnt lessen the movies appeal while youre watching it, though it drastically shortens the afterglow.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: There was a lot of economic damage. But the greater damage is to the future. How many retailers will want to come to Baltimore? How many conventions will stay away? How many hotel rooms will stay empty?

description: NEW YORK

description: Curious children gathered around an American military medical team that visited their village in Vietnam in 1969. One of the medics, Bob Shirley, turned his camera on them and they stared back.

title: On Trade: Obama Right, Critics Wrong
description: BERLIN  I strongly support President Obamas efforts to conclude big, new trade-opening agreements with our Pacific allies, including Japan and Singapore, and with the whole European Union. But I dont support them just for economic reasons.

title: Goodbye to Freddie Gray and Goodbye to Quietly Accepting Injustice
description: WASHINGTON  IN the spacious sanctuary of Baltimores New Shiloh Baptist Church, at the funeral of Freddie Gray on Monday, the familiar weight of grief descended over me, not just for Mr. Gray, but for the countless Freddie Grays across black America who die, unarmed, at the hands of the police.

title: The Pope Joins the Climate Wars
description: Since his papacy began in March 2013, Pope Francis has amply demonstrated his readiness to take on tough social and political causes. Now, much to the dismay of some conservatives, he is confronting human-caused global warming. A high-level workshop in the Vatican this week on the moral dimensions of climate change is one of several major events planned by the Roman Catholic Church in anticipation of an encyclical on the environment the pope plans to issue this summer. Though only the broad outlines are known, the encyclical is already raising hopes among environmentalists and deep alarm among climate-skeptics.

title: Love, Marriage and Music
description: At some point in my childhood, just before my teens, I was struck by the fact that almost all of the songs that I was hearing on the radio, half-consciously humming along to or committing to memory were about love.

title: What Greece Faces if It Defaults
description: BUENOS AIRES  WHEN President Adolfo Rodrguez Sa told Congress on Dec. 23, 2001 that the Argentine state will suspend the payment of its foreign debt, legislators jumped to their feet with joy. Their cheering quickly morphed into a chant of Ar-gen-ti-na! Ar-gen-ti-na!

description: To the Editor:

title: Barclays Profit, Weighed Down by Legal Costs, Fell 52% in First Quarter
description: LONDON  The British bank Barclays said on Wednesday that its first-quarter profit fell 52 percent as its results were dragged down once again by legal costs, primarily related to investigations into the possible manipulation of foreign currency trading markets.

title: Hong Kong Student Organization Says It Wont Attend Tiananmen Vigil
description: This June, for the first time, Hong Kongs largest student organization may not attend an annual candlelight vigil marking the 1989 military crackdown on pro-democracy demonstrators in Beijing.

description: A look backstage at the Late Show as David Letterman nears the end of his more than 33 years in late-night television.

title: Rapid Change in Hells Kitchen
description: Until around the early 1980s, Hells Kitchen was considered a dangerous place to live. It was like the Wild West, said Kathleen Treat, the chairwoman of the Hells Kitchen Neighborhood Association, citing the crime that was prevalent for decades.

title: Ukraine Separatists Rewrite History of 1930s Famine
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  Yevdokiya was still a young girl, her nephew recalled, when the neighbors invited her over for a social occasion of some sort. This was during the great famine of 1933, he said, and her family became alarmed when she failed to return.

description: Long before the World Trade Center rose downtown, Irving T. Bush tried to create one just a few steps from Times Square.

title: Supreme CourtJustices Hear Oklahoma Inmates Lethal Injection Case
description: WASHINGTON  Lawyers for three condemned Oklahoma prisoners who claimed that the three-drug combination that could be used to execute them risked causing unconstitutional pain and suffering ran into skepticism from conservative members of the Supreme Court on Wednesday.

title: Gender Bias Issue Could Tip Chief Justice Roberts Into Ruling for Gay Marriage
description: WASHINGTON  In a telling moment at Tuesdays Supreme Court arguments over same-sex marriage, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. suggested that he may have found a way to cast a vote in favor of the gay and lesbian couples in the case.

title: David Letterman Reflects on 33 Years in Late-Night Television
description: In a single bound, David Letterman seemed to leap the full length of the stage at the Ed Sullivan Theater, racing from backstage as if hed been thrust forward by the fanfare played by his longtime bandleader, Paul Shaffer, and his CBS Orchestra, and by the rumble of his announcer, Alan Kalter, bellowing his name  Daaaaay-vid Leh-terrrr-maaaaaaaan!

title: Hillary Clinton Laments Missing Black Men as Politicians Reflect on Baltimore Unrest
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton had not planned to make the first major policy speech of her presidential campaign an impassioned plea to mend the nations racial fissures and overhaul an out-of-balance criminal justice system.

title: An Ice Age Heritage, Nearly Lost
description: VILA NOVA DE FOZ CA, Portugal  After a long, grinding descent through rocky terraces planted with almond trees, Thierry Aubry eased a battered four-wheel-drive vehicle to a halt on a patch of level ground above the wild Ca River in northeast Portugal.

title: The Turner House, by Angela Flournoy
description: In The Turner House, an engrossing and remarkably mature first novel by Angela Flournoy, Detroit has been hit hard by the crisis in the auto industry. Its 2008, and Viola, the ailing matriarch of the Turner clan, has moved in with her son Cha-Cha, leaving her house empty  temporarily, she insists, though we sense shell never return. Her 13 children will have to decide what to do with the home in which they grew up, and it wont be easy. Viola refinanced in 1994, after her husband died; now she has a $40,000 mortgage, and the house is worth about a tenth of that. This isnt unusual on Yarrow Street, where abandoned homes dot the landscape, and Cha-Cha pays the electric bill on his mothers unoccupied house to hold off the looters.

title: Days of Rage, by Bryan Burrough
description: In 1965 Carl Oglesby was elected president of Students for a Democratic Society, the principal campus-based organization of the 1960s New Left. S.D.S. then had some 10,000 members; over the next few years, thanks to swelling opposition to the Vietnam War among young Americans, it expanded tenfold.

title: Exploring Why Some People Get Fitter Than Others
description: Anyone in a running group or gym class has likely noticed that some of the participants annoyingly become much fitter than others. But exactly why some peoples bodies respond well to working out and others do not puzzles scientists.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: When the Cyberbully Is You
description: Why are people so mean on the Internet? Its a question we have been trying to answer for more than a decade, but the matter seems to be reaching a cultural boiling point.

title: Supreme Court Hearing on Same-Sex Marriage Poses Logistical Challenge
description: Jill Agostino is the day editor in The Timess Washington bureau.

title: Volkswagens Net Profit Rises 19% Amid Recovery in Western Europes Car Market
description: FRANKFURT  Volkswagen, Europes largest carmaker, said on Wednesday that net profit rose 19 percent in the first quarter as the auto market in Western Europe recovered.

title: Daily Report: Breaking News About Twitter, on Twitter
description: Selerity, a financial analytics firm, recently released a study about how news events break on Twitter. On Tuesday, however, Selerity made news about Twitter, Mike Isaac reports.

title: Morning Agenda:  A Tweet Sinks Twitters Stock
description: A TWEET SINKS TWITTERS STOCK | It was a tumultuous day for Twitter after an unexpected tweet about the companys disappointing earnings report immediately clobbered Twitters stock, which ended up falling 18 percent by the end of Tuesdays trading session, Vindu Goel writes in The New York Times. Investors were unhappy with Twitters revenue, which grew 74 percent in the quarter  less than the 97 percent growth seen in the fourth quarter and below the companys own forecasts.

title: Atlanta for Kids
description: The South loves families, and Atlanta is a shining example of a city dedicated to amusing children. A traveling family with a car and the will to navigate the citys sprawling freeway system can consume a steady diet of lush parks in what some call the city in a forest. There is a well-regarded zoo and a botanical garden. Youll find rivers, water parks and plenty of Coca-Cola products in the city that is home to the companys headquarters  all of which are especially welcome in the Southern summer heat.

title: Enter Scott Walker, Stage Right
description: As Scott Walker has transformed himself from a three-time statewide winner in blue-leaning Wisconsin to a hard-right Republican primary candidate, he has jumped to the head of the pack in Iowa and New Hampshire.

title: N.F.L. Mock Drafts Are Often Accompanied by an Oops
description: It is N.F.L. draft season. Or more precisely, it is N.F.L. mock draft season.

title: How Lincoln Became Our Favorite President
description: Today Americans almost universally regard Abraham Lincoln as our greatest president. And yet he was not always the revered figure that he has become.

title: The Mysteries of Manhattans Curry Row
description: Curtains of chile-pepper lights that look like Christmas at the bordello, sitar players in every window, seven courses of food for $7.95: Ive always thought of Curry Row on East Sixth Street as one of the great minor mysteries of New York City. How did a clone colony of Indian restaurants sprout on one random block in the East Village? Is it true that they all share a kitchen? And why are they lit like a rager in the art-school darkroom?

title: Can Bitcoin Conquer Argentina?
description: Dante Castiglione stalked through the doors of a glass-walled office tower on the edge of downtown Buenos Aires, just a few hundred feet from the old port district. In the crowded elevator, he shook his head and muttered under his breath about the stresses of the day and his profession. I swear, this job can kill me, he said, his eyes cast downward.

title: Want a Steady Income? Theres an App for That
description: Heather Jacobs, a chain-spa masseuse in Simi Valley, Calif., never knows how much money is coming her way. When her spa charges $99 for a 55-minute massage, she makes $18. But if she books just two massages in a six-hour workday, the spa must raise her days pay to minimum wage, which is $9 an hour. Jacobs, who is 28, cant be sure how many hours she will get or how many walk-ins will choose her  a 5-foot-2, 96-pound masseuse who looks as if she could manage only a 1 on the four-point pressure scale, though she is really a 3, verging on a 4. Her paychecks, which come every two weeks, have been as high as $700 and as low as $90. She also freelances for a gym, offering passers-by free massages on the chance they might join; the gym doesnt pay her, so for that she earns only tips. She seeks out private clients too, especially around the 27th of the month, when her credit-card bill, with its $90 minimum payment, is due.

title: Police Silence in Baltimore
Today in Politics: Baltimore Riots Pressure Washington to Act
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where all the prognosticators are parsing the justices comments during Supreme Court arguments in the same-sex marriage case. But focus continues to fall primarily on Baltimore, where the riots and protests have raised the stakes for government leaders to ease the tensions between police departments and the communities they serve.

title: Should I Lend Money to My Irresponsible Parents?
description: My parents mismanaged their finances to the point of bankruptcy several years ago and are now in pretty significant mortgage arrears. Foreclosure looms. They seem to believe that $4,000 or $5,000 will catch them up. Their monthly fixed-retirement income of over $6,000 should be fine to sustain them, but not with their uncontrolled spending and inability to face reality. The timing of this is about to coincide with a moderately expensive kitchen remodel at our own house. Should we write them a check for $4,500 and feel guilty about our expenditures on things like countertops, or allow them to face the consequences of their financial decisions? I love my parents and hate to see them suffer, but Id rather help them in a sustainable way than continue to throw money at the old world they refuse to leave. Is this selfish, judgmental, beside the point? NAME WITHHELD

title: How Do You Feel About Whats Happening in Baltimore?
description: Armored vehicles lined this battered citys main thoroughfares and thousands of law enforcement officers and National Guard troops worked to maintain order and enforce a citywide curfew Tuesday night, amid scattered reports of unrest after a day of largely peaceful protests, reported The Times on Wednesday morning.

title: Baltimore Leaders Try to Curb Expectations Over a Pending Police Report
description: BALTIMORE  An edgy peace held sway here as a huge crowd took to the streets before a curfew Wednesday night and the mayor and the police sought to tamp down expectations that residents would learn details on Friday about how a young black man died after being injured in police custody.

title: British Trader Charged in Flash Crash Fails to Post Bail
description: LONDON  Navinder Singh Sarao, the 36-year-old British futures trader charged with contributing to a sudden plunge in American stock markets, has not met the conditions of his bail, his lawyer said Wednesday in a London court. He has remained in custody since his arrest on April 21.

title: U.S. Economy Grew at 0.2% Rate in First Quarter

title: DKNY Names 2 Creative Directors and Also Poaches From Apple
description: DKNY, the more accessible sibling line of Donna Karan International, is getting a whole new look. Given that DKNY is responsible for 80 percent of the company business, according to Pierre-Yves Roussel, chairman and chief executive of the LVMH Fashion Group, this is a big deal.

title: Tax Hit in France and Hedge Funds Weigh on Carlyle
description: The Carlyle Group reported a weaker first quarter on Wednesday, hurt by a bigger-than-expected tax bill in France and weighed down by its hedge fund portfolio.

title: Anna Kendrick on Pitch Perfect 2 and Not Trying Too Hard
description: LOS ANGELES  Having acted in 15 movies over the last three years, Anna Kendrick is well versed in the indignities of the modern publicity trail, where stars are increasingly expected to do much more than engage in witty banter. Marie Claire once asked Ms. Kendrick to get drunk during an interview. She complied. In January, at the request of Nylon magazine, she spoke to a reporter while hanging from a trapeze.

title: Esperanza Spalding and Taylor Mac in Lineup for Celebrate Brooklyn
description: The jazz musician Esperanza Spalding, the theater star Taylor Mac and the country singer Jason Isbell are among the headliners of the 37th annual Celebrate Brooklyn Festival in Prospect Park. The festival, held at the Bandshell and organized by the arts organization BRIC, will take place June 3 through Aug. 12 and feature music, film, dance and an art installation.

title: China Confirms Killings on Border With North Korea
description: The police in a small town on Chinas border with North Korea say three residents were killed early on Saturday, raising concerns of another attack by rogue North Korean soldiers crossing into the country to steal food and money.

title: Russian Space Station Cargo Ship Is Said to Be Out of Control
description: MOSCOW  Russias top space officials announced Wednesday that they would scuttle an unmanned cargo spacecraft that is orbiting the Earth after it malfunctioned on its way to resupply the International Space Station.

title: 11th-Hour Deal Spared Philippine Woman From Indonesian Firing Squad
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  A last-ditch effort by the Philippines, involving a human trafficking case and frantic personal phone calls by the president, led to a dramatic deal with Indonesia that plucked a Philippine woman from a firing squad moments before she was to join eight other prisoners at a mass execution early Wednesday.

title: How to Make Sense of Weak Economic Growth in 2015
description: Another year, another winter slump.

title: For a Child With Learning Differences, Making Home a Safe Harbor
description: Recently, a mother approached me for advice about how to support her daughter, who has learning differences. In a large family of children for whom most of school comes easily, with parents who could say the same about their own pasts, the little girl is often frustrated by comparing herself. Worse, the mother says, both the siblings and, sometimes, the parents, can (unintentionally) reveal their own frustration when the child cant solve a problem or perform a task. Those moments threaten to erode her belief in herself and her abilities.

description: New York may have its shocking exhibitions of new art, of nudes descending staircases, of naughty undraped dancing figures and such things, but there is a town within forty-five minutes of Broadway which will stand for none of these new-fangled ideas: New Rochelle.

description: Lumber Liquidators reported a net loss in the first quarter as the company continued to dispute accusations that its Chinese-made laminate flooring contained dangerous levels of formaldehyde.

description: Despite a hipster Republican millennial ad campaign, the popularity of the Conservative Political Action Conference and the prevalence of Taylor Swift-animated gif press releases from prominent Republicans, young voters still predominantly back Democrats when it comes to presidential elections, according to a new poll by Harvard University. But their edge is starting to shrink.

We immediately fell in love, sorrowfully parting when she left for a semester abroad but writing each other letters during our separation (this was 1991) with the avidity of Bront characters.

title: The 1990 N.F.L. Draft Class: Some Thrive, but Just as Many Struggle
description: On Thursday night in Chicago, N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell will welcome to the stage the best new members of his league as they are selected in the first round of the draft. Yet some of the first-round picks from 25 years ago would struggle to walk the same distance.

title: Jean Nidetch, a Founder of Weight Watchers, Dies at 91
description: She never ate dessert in public. But at night, by the dim light of the refrigerator, she gorged on goodies. Then one day in 1961, Jean Nidetch, a 214-pound Queens housewife with a 44-inch waist and an addiction to cookies by the box, ran into a neighbor at the supermarket.

title: Black Out

description: LOS ANGELES  Gov. Jerry Brown issued an executive order Wednesday sharply speeding up this states already ambitious program aimed at curbing greenhouse gas emissions, saying it was critical to address an ever-growing threat posed by global warming to the states economy and well-being.

description: SAN FRANCISCO  On the par-4 10th hole at TPC Harding Park on Wednesday, Marc Leishman missed the fairway with his drive. To reach the green, he had a gap of less than a yard between two Monterey Cypress trees.
